reviewTitle: Lights wake you up at night, software is annoying for neurodivergent people.
reviewDescription: Honestly the functionality is fine. The speaker works, basic questions can get answered, alarm function is good, connection to Spotify is pretty good, etc. The clock works just fine, but even though it dims at night, it's still way too bright.The review below this paragraph was written for the Echo Pop, but as the software is the same, it 100% applies to this device as well. I dislike the software of the Pop, but the Dot I truly hate as a whole package. Don't put it in a bedroom if you value your sleep at all. We've been awakened several times by lights. Once a bright yellow light came on and we had no idea why. All of our notifications are turned off. When we tried to ask why it glowed yellow, it said it had no answer for that. Apparently updates can make it go bright blue, and it has a few times. The most annoying is when the power goes out. The light can light up several times as it powers back up, then attempts to reconnect, and attempts to reconnect, and attempts to reconnect... (the WiFi gets knocked out, too, so sometimes it can take a while for everything to get moving again). I finally unplugged the thing one night last week when we were having intermittent power outages and the next day I ordered a new clock for the bedroom. (We've had the Dot since April and it is now December, so we've put up with a lot hoping it would get better.) The voice has only come on once in the night, but the lights seem to have a mind of their own. 100% CANNOT recommend for a bedroom.Our issue is the constant tweaking and changing that occurs in the software itself. It really does appear that Alexa is programmed to constantly figure out new ways to bother you. It reminds me of a loud kid's toy that sounds like it's off and then suddenly yells out, "DON'T YOU WANT TO PLAY WITH ME?!" Amazon doesn't seem content with allowing Alexa to be something that sits on your desk and functions the way you want it to function, without bothering you in any way. They haven't made something that can just sit on your desk and function the way you ask it to function.We have every single notification turned off, we've turned on "brief mode" which is supposed to make Alexa speak as little as possible. Still, no matter what we do, Amazon seems determined to program Alexa to ask us questions for every question we ask, sometimes completely out of left field. It's like the thing gets more and more desperate to be useful beyond the functions we've designated. At first, when asking for the weather today, it would constantly ask if we wanted the weather for the whole week. No. I said today because I want today's weather. Eventually that stopped, but then it started asking completely random stuff. The most recent one was, after asking the weather, it asked if I want to be updated on new movies as they come out. What? It's ridiculous. If I want the weather, now I just Google it.Setting timers, same thing. You'd think set a timer, how easy it is. No, it asks questions about entertaining you while you wait. Or other random things that have nothing to do with what you just asked. No, please just set a timer. If I don't have one handy and I need a timer now, I just have Google do it.My daughter was really enjoying asking how many days until Christmas and her birthday, and for a long time, Alexa would give the number of days. Now it has switched to months and weeks. I didn't ask how long until this event. We specify "how many days" and now no matter how I ask the question, some programming change has made it impossible to get the number of days. My daughter's little morning ritual is gone. She loved asking and hearing the reply, but now I just Google it and she's learning to read the numbers instead. Even with those very simple questions, though, it would ask things like "would you like to hear a Christmas joke?" No. I just want to be told the number of days and then have the device go quiet.There are many other little issues here and there. For a while, brief mode seemed to stop all of that, but it's back full force and I can't figure out how to shut it off. Probably many neurotypical people won't understand how stressful it feels, but not knowing if the device will just be silent after I ask my question, and never knowing what it will say or ask makes me never want to use it. My autistic son unplugged his because he couldn't stand it, either. I thought it would be so helpful, and I bought multiples for our house, but honestly there are plenty of other options out there for all of the functionality of this thing when I need it. I was hoping it could be centralized in one thing, but in their desperation to make the Alexa devices oh-so-useful and indispensable, Amazon has made them annoying, especially for anyone with any kind of neurodivergence.

reviewTitle: Tried two of these, both are Echo Duds!
reviewDescription: Updated: Shortly after writing my review, Amazon reached out to me to better understand what was going on with my Echo. They were very nice, but didn’t have any suggestions on how to fix my issue. Since I had them on the phone, I asked to do another exchange, which they agreed to. I am now on my third one and I still have the exact same issues. I have, however, learned how to get my Echo to play music. I ask as though I’m asking another device to play music on this one. So instead of just asking it to play, I tell it to play (Beethoven) on my Kitchen Echo Dud. As long as I request it by device name then it will play on that device. If I forget then I get the same message that that device is offline.Original: I love my Echo products and have a house full of them - with and without screens. However, this generation of Echo Dot with clock seems to be buggy.I bought this one during the holiday season. Right out of the box, I had problems. Set up went without a hitch, and everything seemed to be working other than using it to play music. No matter what streaming service I used, I'd ask it to play something and it would respond appropriately (ie playing Beethoven on Apple Music.) Then there would be a pause, nothing would happen, and then it would say "Sorry, that device is offline." I could then ask it for my news or anything else that would require an internet connection, and it worked just fine.  I could also go to another Echo device and ask it to play music everywhere or on the Echo Dud, and it would play. I assumed there would be a software update that would fix everything so I didn't worry about it right away, and frankly, I almost completely forgot about that device. Luckily, I remembered that I should follow up on it before my extended holiday return window closed. It still wasn't playing music but everything else worked. I rebooted, I did a factory reset - all with the same results, so I called customer service for answers on how to fix this. He had me do all the same steps, again with the same results, then had me box it up to return and they sent me a replacement.I was disappointed to learn that Amazon didn't send me a brand new Echo, but a refurbished one. I regretted involving customer service then, because I could have just initiated my own exchange and gotten a new one since I was still within the return window. However, the replacement did work as expected, so I swallowed my disappointment.I have now been using this Echo Dud with clock for about four months. I primarily use this one for adding items to my shopping list or setting timers.  Perhaps a couple times a month I ask it to play music too. I'm not sure exactly when that feature stopped working, but once again it says it will play and then says the device is offline. Everything else that requires internet continues to function, and I can initiate music playback by asking another device to play on that one. I've tried to reboot and factory reset with no changes in the results.I don't know what is wrong with this device, but I'd steer clear of this generation!

reviewTitle: Cannot turn off "Connected to . . ." announcement.  Detailed user manual costs extra.
reviewDescription: Like so much technology, in order to make life "easier," the Amazon Echo Dot with Clock (Fifth Generation) makes things much more complicated . . . and expensive.The instructions provided with the Echo Dot are very basic.A user manual that apparently gives a full overview of how to use the device costs an additional $11.99 - $15.20--through Amazon.When the device connects to my computer, tablet, or mobile telephone (which is often several times an hour), it makes an announcement "Now connected to . . ."--that cannot be disabled.  (Over time, I have come to find this feature incredibly annoying.)I have read several other Echo Dot owners complain about this issue and say it would be quite simple for Amazon to make it possible to disable this feature.However, the only answer I have received from Amazon Staff through its "Digital and Device Forum" for the Echo Dot with Clock is:  "currently this feature can not be disabled."For the price, the speaker's sound quality is quite good--but not great.I spend far more time dealing with problems the Echo Dot creates than it ever saves me.If I could make the decision over again, I would not buy this device.  It creates more problems than it solves.

reviewTitle: Mixed bag, pros and cons, heavy on the cons
reviewDescription: We wanted to love these and we ordered six during prime day, as part of an effort to ramp up smart home automation. We replaced several older dots.The good: they look nice, they sound good, the visual display is a nice touch.The bad:- the listening ability is wonky on all of them. Sometimes they hear commands, often not. We end up shouting and/or repeating.- they’re supposed to be able to detect occupancy. This was clutch for us for automations and a big part of why we upgraded. It works well on exactly ONE of the dots we bought. Four are intermittent, and one just didn’t work at all (after all the troubleshooting, sensitivity settings, etc). Which brings me to—- poor customer service. To return the one non-functional one (overlooking the frustration at the intermittent ones), we had to follow a unique process, pack up part of the kit, and the rep I spoke with on the phone sounded exhausted and angry. It was time consuming and confusing, but eventually we got a return authorization. We waited to send back until we got a replacement. Replacement took forever; received yesterday and, surprise!, its occupancy detection is not fully functional (it’s intermittent). I think we are going to give up, keep it, and spend additional money to get motion sensors (requiring another hub).We’re super disappointed in not only these devices but in Amazon. We are also bummed out that we’ve now made a big investment in these and other smart devices based on using Alexa as the backbone for smart home, and that seems like it was a mistake. We were hoping for dots that did what they said they’d do, good support, and easy integrations. The first two are a “no” and the third one is also hit or miss, but in many cases that is down to third party devs and the confusing ecosystem of smart home infrastructures.Giving two stars instead of one because the good characteristics are good.===Updated: changed from a two-star review to a one-star review. More of these did not work as expected (occupancy sensing), and the return experience with Amazon has gone from "pretty good" to "OMG this is insanely bad". We buy a lot from Amazon and rarely return things, so maybe this has been an issue for a while, and I'm just finding out about it.In any case: if you're planning to use these as speakers, great. If you want to use them to interact with Alexa, they are less-good than the old Gen3 dots. If you want to use them for smart home automation based on sensing, they are absolutely worthless: save your upgrade money and get some standalone motion or occupancy sensors instead.

reviewTitle: Jeff Bezos, your customers deserve better!
reviewDescription: As far as Alexa devices go, this thing is more Fred flintstone than it is George Jetson. Seriously, how is this an improvement?? I've owned several iterations of Alexa, and this one is by far the worst. It really feels like a huge step backwards. I rarely write bad reviews, but this thing is a heaping pile of trash, so it is well deserved. And now I hear that Amazon is planning to bill us monthly for using Alexa?? Consider me gone if that happens, but I digress…I have several complaints, but the biggest is that it only works about half the time. The rest of the time, when I give it commands, I am met with an extremely annoying response saying, “I'm sorry I didn't get that, the internet isn't reachable”. This is completely false, since all the other devices in my house are working perfectly, including my other, older versions, of Alexa! This is the only version to ever do this to me (along with the countless other poor souls that have also experienced it), and even resetting it and my router (unplugging and plugging back in), doesn’t fix it. It eventually fixes itself after about ten minutes, but not before peak irritation level is achieved.As if this weren’t bad enough, the thing is just ugly. It looks like it should have been the very first demo version of Alexa, the one that existed in the olden times, long before LCD screens existed. And what’s with the big ugly block font it uses? Is it made for a child? Very bizarre design choices.In truth, I'm actually a big supporter of Amazon, and I even admire Mr. Bezos and what he has built, but feelings can change. I am probably going to switch to a different brand as soon as I have some time to shop better options.

just bought the alexa eco dot 5TH Genetation,got the device was so excited but when i whent to set it up, it paired with my bluetooth, but would not connect to my wifi, called customer service, the lady barely could speak english good an spoke really fast, finally got her slow down an speak planer,, followed her adivce to set up my alexa, nothing was working,i was talking to her with my bluetooth earbuds on , which i'm able to connect with two divices, so i thought it was because i was on my earbuds that nothing was working, so i disconnected my earbuds an now the alexa disconnets from bluetooth  also an now will not reconnect to my bluetooth meanwhilethe lady i'm talking begins to ignor me when i'm trying to talk to her, very disrespectful, i'm returing this because it wont even connect to my bluetooth now or wifi. i wish i could 0, stars so i guess you get 1 star, but i'm giving customer service a big fat 0 stars.

When I ask Alexa to play on the second floor, it responds that it will be playing XXX and starts playing on the wrong floor. That is infuriating because I do have Echos in my kids rooms and they can be sleeping.Called some service guys who replied instead of calling my husband. It just tries to autocorrect the name if it doesn’t know the name. My husband had a pretty common Eastern European name WTF, why do I need to rename it in my contacts as husbandRefuses to play * do you know the ice cream man * but plays Die Antwoord because of kids settings. lol Die Antwoord is super explicit.Doesn’t sync up process for Audiable, often when I play my book later in a car it’s just playing whatever missing my progress from Alexa and it’s super hard to find where are you at.When you ask to play XXX podcast normally you want the most recent and not a half played podcast from a year ago.Playing bands with wrong spelling is a nightmare. Does not allow me to dictate the spelling.When you change your phone you need to sync your device again even if you have Alexa pp one there, I kinda assumed that if your account is open you can still play music from your phone anyways.

reviewTitle: Defective item, less that 3 weeks of use.
reviewDescription: My Echo Dot  arrived on July 17. It was on sale and I was super excited about it. It worked perfectly until August 10 when the connecting blue light started spinning. I disconnected the equipment, waited a couple of seconds ( and minutes) and tried to connect it again, this did not work. I pressed the action button as instructed, this did not work. I tried reseting it, again……. It did not work. I read if non of that worked, to deregister Echo and start registration again. Nope……. Did not work.  I tried to start a replacement claim and it instructed me to contact  costumer services. I disconnected my Echo all night, hopping that it was going to reset by morning. Guess what? IT DID NOT WORK. I contacted costumer services and to my surprise, they said I had to start a trade in process as as i had deregisterd the echo from my alexa app. I was frustrated and told the agent that this was a NEW item, that had  3 weeks of use.  I do not want a refund, i dont want. Trade in, i just want my item replaced. She said that because Echo was deregistered, my only choice was to buy another one and wait for the refund. I told her that i was going to retun the defective item and get my refund to buy another one at a retail store where it would have been easier to get it replaces if defective. She stated that the only way my money would be refunded was if I buy a new one with them.I am very disappointed  and upset. Of corse i will get back what i paid as it was on sale, but i had to buy new one  at full price. If i wanted to pay full price, why would I wait for a sale. It would have been fair to just REPLACE my defective item!

reviewTitle: Bought it to get rid of the glitches of the old one. This one glitches just as bad
reviewDescription: This very well may be the last alexa I’ll ever purchase, in a bad way. They are so ridiculously glitchy that I end up having to restart them daily. I have to repeat commands a minimum of 3 times, alarms going off is unreliable, and you know the spinny wheel of death on a computer? Well, beware of the spinny light of death from Alexa where she lights up, thinks for about a minute, then just ignores you. Bonus! She’s terrible at recognizing commands. No, I don’t want to add “lights condo” to my shopping list when I slowly tell you to turn my lights on and to daylight.But hey, if you like being woken up in the middle of the night with a random ad for Amazon music, go for it I guess.

reviewTitle: Waste of money, for me anyway.
reviewDescription: I was only using this as a night light, for the clock and occasional music from my iphone but I keep having to pull the plug because this thing just starts to play random music and tonight it was some horrible rap music which was very intrusive and scary. It was originally connected to my iphone but when I bought an S24 Ultra I did not bother connecting it to the Echo. I just can't trust this thing to behave. It will go weeks without any trouble and then it goes off on it's own. I tried all the fixes but it is just defective. We have the original Amazon Echo downstairs which never gives us a problem. $40 down the drain.

I have many Echo devices (10), but the Echo Dot with clock is the only one that has failed over and over.  Each time has been a failure in the same way.  It listens to a command but doesn't execute the command.  The blue ring keeps circling and then it goes off after a few more seconds and does nothing.  If I repeat the command, it may do the same thing again.  Sometimes it takes 4 or 5 attempts before it will execute the command, when I have the patience for it.The first one I thought it was locking up so I would unplug it, wait for it to boot up and then it would work...that time.  But the alarm the next morning may exhibit the same behavior of not responding.  After a couple months, I replaced it and threw out the defective one.  The next one worked fine for several months but then started doing the same thing.  This time I thought maybe it was my wireless connection that wasn't strong enough in my bedroom, even though this didn't make sense since I had a router just 25 feet away.  But it was an extender and I thought it sometimes disconnected from the main router.  But again, everytime I unplugged the echo, it would work again right after it booted up.  I threw it out and bought another as a black friday deal.This third one I felt good about.  I had just upgraded the house wifi to about the best money can buy.  Netgear Orbi WiFi 7 with wired satellite mesh extender.  No chance of bad wifi signal now.  But the echo started malfunctioning almost right away.It's extremely irritating when you try to snooze the morning alarm and it just keeps going off with a blue ring and doing nothing.  Ok....so no more snoozing with this echo.Final test to confirm this echo is absolute garbage....I put another echo right next to it.  This was an echo 4th gen with premium sound I moved from the bonus room.  The wake word for it was changed to ziggy.  So now when I get the malfunction on the echo dot, I use the ziggy wake word and repeat the command.  I have never had an issue with the command on the bigger echo sitting right next to it.Amazon, you need to fix this device.  It is garbage.  I love the other 9 different model echo devices I have but this one is pure crap.

I purchased this in hopes to use it bedside as an alarm clock and bluetooth speaker primarily and as an Alexa assistant secondary.  Unfortunately this has failed for both my primary needs.  With respect to an alarm clock, the display at it's lowest setting is just too bright.  I have a tough time understanding why the user cannot dial down the brightness a few more levels.  Worse yet, the bluetooth design of this device is the worst I've experienced simply because it feels the need to announce the device it's playing from each time.  I have my phone connected to this every night to play white noise while I sleep.  My partner sleeps in later than I do and if I'm awake in another part of the house and open an app (tumblr, google, etc) that could utilize this speaker it announces in a loud voice "Now playing from iPhone...."  Even if I'm in an article that has an ad (with my phone sound off) that COULD play sound but does not it makes this announcement and wakes up my partner.  Worse yet, if I realize that I need to disconnect the phone from the dot before it makes the announcement, the dot plays a noise when I disconnect.  I have stopped using this device due to these reasons.

I bought this in lieu of a wake up light alarm clock because I couldn't find one that was also a Bluetooth speaker for less than $100. But I hate it. I've had it several months and find it to be just as inconvenient and as much a hassle as any of the cheap wake up light clocks I ever tried.No matter how many settings I adjust and play with, the light just turns on to a set brightness, there is no gradual increase. I've tried on both the Alexa app and the Hue app.I do NOT want Alexa to tell me she is connected to my phone. I don't want her to tell me when I initially connect, nor do I want her to SCREAM it at 2 am because I rolled over and checked my phone. Because yes, if you wake your phone up she will again tell you she is connected. She also WILL NOT execute play, skip, pause, resume commands if you're using Spotify. She will instead open Amazon Music. Even though I have Spotify set as my default.I have tried seven hundred ways to tell her to stop my alarm, but every single time, she then asks me if I'd like to cancel ALLL my alarms. No. No I do not. And why would I want to? I have even asked her directly how to make her stop asking me.I also tried to get my alarm to stop going off at a certain time and switch to playing NPR Radio to no avail.I have scoured the internet for solutions to these problems and I am not alone in my irritation, there is apparently no way to make her stop doing these things. I have turned off hunches, I have brief mode on, and whisper mode. My husband is a programmer and even he can't figure this thing out. I wish I had stuck to my cheap (but clunky) wake up light alarm and separate Bluetooth speaker. I didn't want to have to open an app every morning to turn my alarm off and disconnect my Bluetooth. But that's what I ended up with.

I had the 1st generation Echo Clock and I decided to trade it for this newest generation because of f long-term connectivity issues.  All my Echo Dots will come back online when the internet drops for updates overnight. It approved a lot over time with the 1st generation,  but it wasn't 100%. The description for the latest generation even alluded to improved connectivity,  so I decided to upgrade. That was a huge mistake. While this new clock was perfect with perfect connectivity when I received it in November  2023, its connectivity has somehow degraded over the past month or so. Did Amazon update the software that supports it? I don't have insight to that. But I wasted $ upgrading my Echo Clock. This is simply frustrating.

reviewTitle: Worst Echo in our home and we have a lot.
reviewDescription: First, the only good thing I can say for this echo is that it is aesthetically pleasing. BUT, it has a very hard time hearing. I have to yell at it several times to get a response. I've only owned it 6 months and I'm so tired of having to scream at it like it needs hearing aids. Secondly, I bought this to go beside the bed since it has a clock and doesn't take up too much space on the nightstand.  But, that doesn't work because the clock is so bright it lights up the whole room and makes a bright light in your face if you turn toward it's face. I have asked it to dim it's light but it says "Sorry, I can't do that."  I have turned the clock feature off for this reason, so that those two issues pretty much takes away the main purposes for buying this particular Echo.  I much prefer the Echo spot that I had before. Unfortunatly, I gave it away thinking I was upgrading. So, I definitely do not recommend this newest echo version. Definitely not worth $59.99.

reviewTitle: Not the same Alexa that once was
reviewDescription: A real good way to get me to pull the power plug or contemplate chunking all of my Alexa devices into the trash is to give me bullish ads after my commands that won't even respond to input until after the marketing ploy is done.  That is bad enough but to also give me the ads at max volume level is just a new low, don't you think?  Enough is enough!

I was expecting a lot from Alexa devices. But she doesn’t respond well to anything but the most basic commands. And sometimes not even those. Like “ Alexa STOP”. It doesn’t do Internet searches. If you have other devices, like a door lock. Sometimes it will open other times it won’t. Talking with the door lock company they say it is a Amazon problem. And I would agree because the door locks own app works EVERY TIME! Even from miles away. Sometimes Alexa says “Sorry the light isn’t responding “ when it does!Very frustrating and most printed documentation is out of date. Even  Amazon’s own in app instructions.Do yourself a favor and wait for a new generation software. Probably one that is a major rework. One after 2024.

reviewTitle: Everything is great except brightness and Alexa can’t hear me
reviewDescription: I work at night and sleep during the day. I have blocked all light from my room, except the Echo Dot.I have to completely turn off the LED display to not be disturbed by the irritating white light while I sleep, even on its lowest setting. There isn’t even an option to change the color of the LED to something less intense, like an orange or a red.Please Amazon, either expand the spectrum of brightness to include even dimmer options, or introduce a different color for use at night. I want to be able to check the time at any time of the day, including if I wake up in the middle on my sleeping time. Anything except that LED bright white light. Please.Another slight complaint is that I have to practically yell across my bedroom to get Alexa to pick up my voice.Once she actually hears me, it works amazing. Please fix those two things. I really want to change my review since everything else works so well.

Plays well but I dislike that I have to shout Alexa louder than my older version for it to actually hear what I'm saying. This version is like a deaf version to me. I'm not sure if it's my specific device since I don't see anyone complaining about there Alexa not hearing commands

I've bought several versions of Amazon Echo Dot and usually, it comes unbroken, but one of these that I've got was broken :(. Alex sometimes picks up when I'm not calling her and it's kind of annoying. It's kind of sensitive, but nonetheless it does the job when I need it to.

reviewTitle: Difficult to set up harder to make it work  Liked the original Alexa better
reviewDescription: Not using for much of anything..  The old triangular show has been the best.

reviewTitle: Looks nice but worse quality than older gens
reviewDescription: Microphone is clearly cheaper than previous versions; my 3rd Gen can pickup my voice when this one you can't. It's frustrating as I wanted something exactly like this.  Wish it worked

It works like a speaker, and does connect to our ring doorbell, but it doesn't ring when we press the doorbell. It does notify us when it detects motion, but doesn't ring consistently. It rang a few times here and here, but not all the time. We ended up having to buy a chime so that we can hear the ring.

This rarely works for me. Have issues where it says it’s playing but no sound comes on, alarms won’t turn off. One time it started playing brockhampton and kids bob at the same time and wouldn’t stop or turn down the volume. Had to pull the plug. In fact I have to pull the plug on this almost weekly

reviewTitle: Horrible display features and lack of settings
reviewDescription: This is not an improvement over the Dot 4. The display style is terrible for those with visual or sensory processing issues. Also it scrolls the title of every song, audiblebook, etc. And I mean the whole title, chapter, etc. If you want to see the clock, too bad. Worse, it does this every time you do anything. So, if, for example, you back your audiobook up a minute or two, which I do all the time, it starts over again with the long scrolling display. They have got to give people more display setting options to let you turn the stuff off and let people adjust the display more for accessibility issues. Shame on you, Amazon, for making a less accessible device. The sound is better, but the display oddities and lack of settings to make choices about what scrolls makes this "upgrade" a poor one.

First, the speaker itself looks nice, and the setup was pretty easy. The sound quality is good also. However, if you’re buying this speaker solely for the music playing part, it works good with Amazon music, but with Apple music it’s definitely a pain. Its “relationship” with Apple music isn’t great at all. I’ve had many problems. Also, sometimes Alexa isn’t cooperative! I’ve been noticing that she’s been going blank after I task or say something. This literally defeats the purpose of “Alexa”. Honestly, the speaker was a disappointment. I would really like to return it. I could’ve bought a different speaker and been a lot more satisfied.
Bought this in May of 2023. Loved it and used it almost everyday. Now the speaker in it sounds like everything is in a bath tub. It's unfortunate
Great product but visuals stopped working after a year.

We just unpacked our new blue Dot.......We are very disappointed that the 5th generation does not have an audio out plug.  We wanted to be able to plug it into our stereo system which has incredible speakers.Unfortunately we didn't unpack it until today and now it's too late to return.
Bought for Christmas present, started issues within a month. Factory reset, "regular reset", every trouble shooting I could find and won't stay connected to internet.

I recently purchased the Amazon Echo Dot (5th Gen) with clock in Glacier White, and it has exceeded my expectations. The standout feature is undoubtedly the enhanced LED display, which adapts seamlessly to ambient lighting – a sleek touch that adds both functionality and aesthetic appeal.The sound quality of this compact smart speaker is remarkable, especially considering its affordable price. Alexa's voice comes through crisp and clear, making it a fantastic addition to any room without compromising on audio performance.Whether I need to check the time at a glance, set timers, or get real-time weather updates, the LED display proves to be a handy feature. The device seamlessly integrates into my daily routine, and the Glacier White finish adds a touch of elegance to its design.The Amazon Echo Dot (5th Gen) with clock is a stellar choice for those seeking a budget-friendly, feature-rich smart speaker. Its adaptive LED display and impressive sound quality make it a standout device in its category. Highly recommended!

The only assistant that I’ve ever had as a separate device was a Google assistant, and a store brand at that. I never used it for much, and it didn’t seem very capable of anything. Over the holidays I ordered an Alexa Dot with the added smart bulb. Wow! Pairing everything took a little work, but once that was done I was off and running. The different routines you can create are wonderful! I liked them so much I ordered 2 more. 2 of them are in rooms with smart bulbs. One is programmed to turn on at a certain time on these dark mornings. Both are programmed to turn off at night and to be turned on by sound and turned off if no one is in the room.There is surely a ton more these things are capable of. They’ll tell you your inside temperature, and you can name each room any silly thing you want. I’ve used the announcements, broadcast, and a few other features. It’s also remarkably helpful when answering questions. That’s been a big plus as well. The sound quality is nice, and they are pleasant to look at. Highly recommend!

reviewTitle: Works as expected plus great sound!
reviewDescription: Use this in the bathroom, I like how it shows the time and plays great sounding music.  It’s much smaller than the 4th generation premium audio echo so its not the best sounding but the low price and small size makes it worth the sacrifice in sound!

Our daily house helper, is this great echo dot device. We order several chores to the dot daily, reminders, pay bills, play songs, say jokes, help with weather, and what no. It has clear sound, loud enough for the living room, easy to use. It’s a helpful device for a minimal price. Worth buying, highly recommended!

reviewTitle: Great help and fun to use
reviewDescription: The product is great when you come in the front door and it's dark in the house, just yell "Alexa lights on" and all the lights are on.  It's great as an intercom system and you can play music throughout the house with multiple dots.  At first I wasn't sure I wanted Alexa listening, there is a button to turn off the listening capability if you desire.  Pairs easily with Amazon smart plug, and Blink cameras.  All in all a great item!

reviewTitle: A perfect blend of form and function
reviewDescription: The Cloud Blue Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022 release) has completely changed my daily routine by integrating cutting-edge technology into an elegant form factor. This smart speaker has been an invaluable addition to my home, providing me with the services of Alexa as well as serving as a stylish and practical clock.I was immediately drawn to the Cloud Blue hue of my new Echo Dot with clock because of how softly it injects a burst of energy into any room. The device's compact size makes it suitable for use in any room of the house, from the bedroom to the kitchen. Amazon's commitment to offering products that complement a wide range of aesthetic preferences is reflected in the subtlety of this one.This smart speaker stands out from the crowd because to its built-in LED clock display. This seemingly minor modification has transformed my Echo Dot from a simple alarm clock into a multifunctional wristwatch. The LED display is easy to read from across the room, and its brightness can be adjusted so that it doesn't keep me up at night. Having the ability to switch between a 12-hour and 24-hour clock face as well as adjusting the clock's brightness is a nice touch.The Echo Dot's brilliance lies in its voice-activated functions, which are made possible by Alexa. Setting alarms, checking the weather, listening to music, and controlling smart home equipment may all be done with just a few phrases. The sound from the 5th generation Echo Dot is superior to those of its predecessors, filling the room with music that is both crisp and balanced. Whether I'm listening to my go-to podcast or a constantly evolving playlist, the Echo Dot always delivers excellent sound quality.Voice control is surprisingly reliable because to the system's several microphones, which allow Alexa to hear my commands even in noisy environments. I was blown away by how well the voice recognition worked. It almost never fails to comply with my demands and provides instant feedback. The Echo Dot has become an indispensable device, allowing me to effortlessly access information, schedule updates, and entertainment.Since privacy and security are so important in today's interconnected world, I am overjoyed by the privacy safeguards Amazon has implemented in the Echo Dot. The ability to switch off the microphones is a convenient feature that allows me to enjoy some peace and quiet whenever I need it. Amazon's openness about data usage and the ability to review and delete voice recordings via the Alexa app are further indications of the company's commitment to user control and data protection.Setting up the Echo Dot was a breeze with the help of the intuitive Alexa app, which took me through the process. The process of linking the device to my Wi-Fi network and making my desired adjustments was quick and painless. The Echo Dot is a good long-term investment because Amazon regularly updates its software to include the most recent features and enhancements.The Echo Dot (5th Gen, 2022) with clock is a great example of smart technology that has been simplified to perform a single, specific task in a time when smart technology may sometimes seem overwhelming. The combination of a high-tech watch and Alexa's brainpower has made my regular tasks much more manageable and enjoyable. The Echo Dot adapts easily to my needs, whether I'm setting an alarm to gently wake me up in the morning or just listening to my favorite music. This smart speaker has seamlessly integrated into my life at home and become an essential tool. The Echo Dot with clock has undeniably merited its five-star rating for its top-notch functionality, sleek design, and helpful contribution to today's simplified lifestyle.

I wasn't sure about this as I have never had Echo Dot before. I ordered the one with a clock. I have only had it  a few days but I love it The sound is GREAT and she answers everything. I have just been having fun with her. I use it in my bedroom as I needed a clock and alarm plus she plays music anytime I want it. It's just FUN and helpful

reviewTitle: Replaced my 20 year old alarm clock
reviewDescription: Ok it actually replaces the alarm clock my husband already owned 21 years ago, which was a gift to himself - a bose with a cd player.  Over the years we gave up on choosing cds so its been teh same cd for the alarm for a decade, which he complained about but was not willing to choose a cd.  Meanwhile it got harder and harder to see the time - not sure if my eyes got older or if the leds started to die.  but it got to the point where this thing takes up SO much space on my bedside table and is regularly annoying me.I dont have any other amazon alexa items.  I just was getting used to google assistant on my pixel.  But this little speaker was super easy to set up.  I only have the free amazon prime music with my prime account, but I was able to tell the dot to set an alarm for 7 am and play a song by (one of my husband's favorite artists), and then go into my phone and make it repeat for weekdays.  So, i wont have to remember to turn it on and off every friday/sunday.  Woot!He didnt seem to appreciate it (grumpy old man) tho he did admit it was easier to wake up to a song he actually likes.  and i realized I can listen to NPR while i do any cleaning in my room.We all dont really like noise - we rarely watch a show together and all of us use headphones in public spaces.  So i cant imagine getting more of these.  But as a replacement for a 21 year old Bose CD alarm clock? I think its a HUGE upgrade!  Easier to read by a huge margin, too.Oh and it glowed yellow and i was panicking - that was too bright for sleeping - but all good, it was just telling me my amazon packages were delivered.Now I need to go check out some sleep activities!

Update 3/10/2024 - Item is being returned even after doing a factory reset it would not continue to play Amazon Music without constant interruptions.  However, I do want to call out the Tech Support person Vijay who spent quite a bit of time assisting via a chat.  Very patient and helpful.  Thank you!Update 3/8/2024 - I would not purchase this item again nor any of the Amazon devices based on the issues with this item and the poor technical support I've received thus far.  I've moved it to 4 different places in my home, rebooted it & my home network.  It continues to randomly turn off when playing Amazon Music.  I'm not having issues with any other device and do not have many devices running.  I've asked for it to turn off after a certain number of hours and also, as tech support suggested, even asked to play in an endless loop (which as I told them made no sense).  Also ensured my Alexa software is updated.  Seems this is a known issue with this item. I'm going to do a factory reset which is all that's left other than returning it.....which will be the first time I've had to return anything I've ordered.  I hope the return process is easier than this has been.Update 2/11 - This Echo still does not continue playing music as expected.  I can give a turn off command of a XX hours and it will turn off way before then.  I've restarted it, moved it, etc and still continues to be problematic.  It can not be my network as this is the only device I have an issue with.This is the first Echo product I've purchased. and I must admit the sound from this is very nice.  My primary use of it is to play music and it sounds excellent.  I am having a problem with the music shutting off.  No rhyme nor reason nor specific amount of time.  I've just tested it to see if i can give a turn off time "Alexa turn music off at XXXX time" so see if that helps.  I have no issues with my WiFi and have very few devices running so can't be the issue.  Lastly and most importantly, my dog is afraid of the Alexa voice coming from the Echo.  I've tried to acclimate her slowly and introduce her to the sound of it (with the music) without her hearing Alexa voice.  She does ok until she hears Alexa voice and she's still afraid of it.  I have to be cognizant of her whereabouts when using it.  I've read about other dogs being afraid - not sure if it's frequency or Alexa voice.

Purchased as an aid to senior parent living on their own and the options to add 10 contacts to call cell#s is great. The ability to have voice recognition, for daily reminders, questions on where a movie is streaming, who was in this movie? Weather information live time, news updates, Alexa is my backup companion for mom. She is getting used to all the things capable as we just set it up 3/10/24 and the Prime music sounds fantastic. She already has a Bose sound system for her TV so she was pleased with the clarity and pure sound of the tiny speaker.  She said Alexa, I love you...and a heart lit up and Alexa sang a super cute song back. She laughed at the AI abilities and is glad for the addition to help add items to a grocery list etc. Great little DOT.  We have the original Alexa Echo taller round tower and now being on same account I can send an announcement to that one if necessary. really nice for $59.00 too.

My engagement with the product under consideration has been marked by profound disappointment. Having purchased said product (two to be exact) in March 2023, my initial enthusiasm stemmed from a prior positive encounter with an earlier iteration that had been gifted to me by a relative. However, the two products I purchased failed to measure up to my expectations.Foremost among the setbacks was the product's persistent inability to establish a connection with my WiFi network. This led me to engage my service provider, whose extensive troubleshooting endeavors unequivocally attributed the issue to the product itself. Regrettably, despite their conscientious efforts, a resolution remained elusive. Subsequent recourse to the product's customer service department yielded a similar outcome: both products I had acquired were indeed flawed per the customer representative's attempt to rectify the issue.Of equal perturbation is not solely the inherent flaw of the products in question, but also the circuitous and convoluted refund process. What was once a straightforward refund procedure has now transformed into a profoundly arduous ordeal to receive my money. This unfortunate state of affairs stands in stark contrast to my years of being an Amazon customer. Regrettably, this situation has left an indelible negative impression, compounded by recent reviews highlighting the persistence of similar concerns/dissatisfaction among other customers.In conclusion, this sequence of events has engendered a discernible disaffection and disillusionment that contradicts the previously solid foundation of trust and satisfaction I had cultivated as an Amazon Prime subscriber.

reviewTitle: Loses Volume - Amazon FIX the Problem!
reviewDescription: Clock Keep Losing Volume. Took a loss on 4th Gen clock to buy the 5th Gen Echo Dot Clock and it has the same problem. No one wants an Alarm clock they can’t Hear! I set it at a level 6 before going to sleep. The base level is a level 3 which it always reverts back to. That level is too soft for an alarm. I’ve slept through several alarms making me late.Amazon, if you are going to sell a product, make sure it works as advertised or FIX THE PROBLEM!!!!

reviewTitle: Would have been nice to know that this was only Wi-Fi connectivity to my sound system
reviewDescription: At what point are you going to update the databanks for this unit it's by far the most favorite it interacts with a lot of products now get it to be able to answer a simple question. JHC I'm not kidding you this thing is going to get thrown into the next snow plow the rating rates the product not the seller he's shifted nicely it was quickly received I have no problem with that it's just a piece of crap and it should have noted that no audio jacks are available

reviewTitle: Avoid at All Costs - Terrible Device
reviewDescription: Update: The item gets worse day by day, and Amazon is absolutely useless.  I have been going back and forth for almost a year and they constantly want to blame my Wi-Fi, which is not the issue, as this is the only device I seem to have trouble with.  I tested 3 different devices in the same location and only this one either does not connect to the group, or at all.  Continues to cut in and out, and I never know if I am going to make it through a playlist or even a song.Purchased from Best Buy in December and have had constant problems with this device.  It constantly loses the connection to the Wi-Fi.  Having spent hours of written communication with Amazon Tech support, all they could say is it has a weak Wi-Fi signal from my router, however, this is the only device I own that consistently loses communication with the Wi-Fi, my computer, my smart televisions, and my phone never lose the connection, and I am running a Linksys Mesh  System with the router and two extenders, so for the life of me I cannot understand the issue.  I constantly check my Wi-Fi signal and it is strong in all rooms, so my only conclusion is that the device is just no good. I also do not run more than 3 devices at one time.I have decided to add to this that, while a tech support person called me and we discussed the issues, they also told me they would call me back on a certain date and time, and guess what?  Never heard a thing, I'm also concerned about why the review says it is "Hidden by sensitivity filters" Does that mean that Amazon is trying to cover up bad reviews?  Hmm, something to think about.

reviewTitle: Took advantage of aka baited and caught
reviewDescription: My wife bought this *and the extended warranty), and she could not set it up as per instructed so, she spent time on hold before the customer service decided to help her (albeit they were probably busy with other buyers of this).After a long talk with the customer service, they finally blamed my internet service (big surprise, and for the record it's Xfinity).So, they told her to call Geekz online which the promptly charged us $175 to connect this thing to our internet.  So, whatever this Dot thing cost, it wound up costing us an extra $175.My advice, DO NOT buy this, as, from what I can tell that all the customer service people will do is send you to another vendor and it will cost you more money than this thing is worth...One other mention, we're seniors on a limited income...  Oh well, I needed to go on a diet anyways.

I want to preface this review by saying my Wi-Fi works great and I have many devices connected to my Wi-Fi at all time that work just fine.I ordered this generation 5 Amazon Echo Dot for my wife. We’ve had a generation 3 for years, and thought it could be useful to buy another for our home. After unwrapping it we tried to set it up. We got through most of the set up steps just fine, but once we got to the step to connect it to Wi-Fi, it just sat and searched for well-over the recommended 5 minutes. After this happened, we tried unplugging it and trying again. We got the same result. I then took it into another room, right next to the Wi-Fi router and tried again. No change in the outcome. On the Amazon app, I started going trough their trouble shooting steps. It walked me through factory resetting the device which still didn’t solve the issue. After trying a little longer (this whole process took about 45 minutes up to this point) I gave up and called their help line. The agent was super kind and proceeded to walk me through the same exact steps that I tried before calling. After 30 minutes on the phone the agent couldn’t help me get any results either. They are sending me a replacement and no additional cost. Hopefully the next one works.Update - I received a new one after the exchange and after working with customer care for two hours trying to troubleshoot the problem they still were unable to help. I am returning this item and getting my money back. I would suggest you keep your money and not waste your time with this item.

It worked for one day! I got it to replace my years old echo that I love.. for the day this played it does not compare to the sound of my old one. It worked right up until this one came out mmmmm…So disappointed! Even my old tiny dot is better than this! The pop is pretty good but this is horrid! Don’t buy unless you are in the market for days of frustration … not even for good sound.forget connection

I was looking to upgrade my working digital clock/alarm from the 90's and separate noise machine in favor of one device. My other Echo seemed user friendly and convenient so I chose this. Pro's: cute, clock numbers auto adjust to the light/dark. That is where it ends. Unfortunately Amazon Prime no longer allows green, white, etc. noise to play for hours or loop. Alexa kindly reminds me of the need to upgrade to the Unlimited plan for that access. Seriously? $40+ for a cute clock plus a monthly fee is not in the budget for those of us on a fixed income. I'll be looking for some type of replacement or wait until Nest Audio comes out with a speaker with integrated clock. BTW, Alexa now shuffles "and similar music" into my playlists and/or stops for no apparent reason. So irritating that I rarely use them any more and miss the enjoyment of listening to the music of my choice. Please check to see what options will be available when considering this item.

I am about tired of this stupid stupid product! Every time I ask her a question she goes I don't know that. And it's ridiculous. What do you mean you don't know that? You are connected to the internet! You absolutely do know that! Search and find the answer! You're just honestly it's just this thing serves no stinking purpose! It's really upsetting me and I'm tired of it it honestly it was cool at first you know I could turn my lights off and on with a schedule or you know whatever but you know all those lights come with a downloadable app that you can do that with this device is absolutely unnecessary seeing as how I can't even search the internet to find the answer that to the question you ask.

reviewTitle: The features I bought it for don't work. Broken app, waste of money.
reviewDescription: I hoped to use the echo dot to play podcasts and as a clock while I sleep so that I wouldn't have to use my phone. The Alexa app was extremely clunky and unintuitive and while it says you can link with Apple podcasts, in reality it doesn't work. Also doesn't have a native podcast player, so podcasts with this speaker are off the table. There were tons of unnecessary annoying features that I couldn't figure out how to turn off like constant notifications. I won't be using it. Waste of money.

reviewTitle: Bought for bedroom because it did not have a screen, but has its own issues
reviewDescription: Bought for the bedroom to replace an Echo Show.  The Show screen seemed a little too bright at night, so was hoping this would solve the problem.  It didn't.The clock letters are much brighter, even at night.  I tried adjusting the slider under LED Display in the hope that it would solve the problem, but it was not a dimmer; just something referred to as "will help adaptive brightness learn your preferences." Still not sure what that is supposed to mean.Even though the slider has a scale from 0 to10 it does not seem to do anything at all.  I tried 1 for a time and then 10, but neither made any detectable difference in the light levels for light or dark.  I finally had to take a lens from a set of sunglasses and tacked them over the numbers.  That works, but not an elegant fix, so, 3 stars.  As for other features, I would have given it a 5.  If you don't need it for the bedroom I would recommend it.

reviewTitle: Works great but one real problem.
reviewDescription: I bought this for my visually impaired father. He loves it. Sounds great. Works easily. But it has one massive problem that really ruin it for visually impaired people. They have a limitation on the number of phone numbers you can call. I’m sure that because it defaults to calling through the internet. But I have it bluetoothed to my dads phone as well and it won’t call through the phone, only through the internet. I don’t understand why they put a cap on the number of phone numbers it can call from. Obviously Alexa to Alexa is free.  But that requires the other person to have one which many will not. It is so simple. “Alexa call”. But he’s blind and cannot see and I had to have him choose 10 phone numbers to use. For any others he has to call a nurse at the assisted living to dial for him. I called their tech support hoping maybe we could pay $5 a month or whatever. Also asked if prime members have this same limitation. And they do. This is a serious hindrance to an early perfect decide for visually impaired people. I guess that’s why the association for the blind in his town recommended the iPhone and apple home pod. But his jitterbug phone bill is $25 a month and his phone was $100. And the echo dot was $60. I love apple ecosystem. But it’s way expensive for a blind man of 93 on a fixed income. We are using the echo dot and it is working for him. But he’s limited to being able to call only 10 of his friends through the device.Second challenge is there is no way for the incoming calls to his cell phone to route through to the echo dot so he can answer the incoming calls to his phone. Even collected through Bluetooth he needs to manipulate the phone which he cannot. On the apple devices this is not a problem. It’s all seamless.It’s too bad. They had a near perfect affordable device. But for whatever reason they decided to impose the 10 number stored limit. Does not seem to be a reason for it. But they did it. Seriously limits and almost perfect affordable device for the blind. Hopefully they will come up with either removing this limitation for print customers or at least a paid service option that would expand this saved number limit.

My old dot was giving me trouble so I ordered this. Sorry I did. It's in the bedroom. If you wear glasses the time is too small to read without them. And for some weird reason when I try to cancel alarm early it tells me alarm was not set. So I took a piece of paper and wrote "alarm Set" on one side and Set Alarm" on the other. I flip it over so I know if alarm is set or not. It still malfunctions. All my old dots worked fine. This one needs a redo.

reviewTitle: Excelente producto, si tienes suscripción y todos los juguetes.
reviewDescription: Positivo*Configuración intuitiva*Si pagas suscripción tienes una gran librería musical casi sin molesta publicidad.*Si integras otros dispositivos inteligentes en tu hogar, puedes controlarlos por voz.*La intercomunicación con otros dispositivos sirve incluso para llamadas hasta entre países diferentes, como si se tratara de un WhatsApp pero desde la comodidad de tu casa y controlado por voz.* Se integra con tu móvil y sirve como parlante Bluetooth.Negativo:*Sin suscripción a Amazon music es imposible escuchar dos canciones sin publicidad.*La inteligencia artificial de Alexa es muy limitada si se compara con las existentes en el mercado como Chat GPT u Google Bard, entre otras.*La integración con el móvil se limita a funcionar como parlante Bluetooth y no permite controlar otras funciones.*Sin otros dispositivos inteligentes y sin suscripción, el dispositivo se limita a búsquedas por Internet (siempre y cuando entienda lo que buscas) o contar chistes porque incluso la traducción falla bastante y es limitada a palabras sueltas pero con bastante fallo.Le doy tres estrellas por el tema de que sin suscripción es básicamente una molestia usarlo y su inteligencia artificial dista de otros competidores líderes, pero aún tiene valor si tienes los dispositivos inteligentes adecuados.

reviewTitle: Works as expected but terrible readout (font)
reviewDescription: I have multiples of many different Echo products so I am a fan. However, I do not like the fifth generation version. The clock numbers (etc.) are created using a series of dots (asterisks) rather than the smooth, more readable lines in the classier fourth gen. The weird creation of the numbers makes the echo dot look cheap, more like a toy, and more difficult to read. This appears to be a case of "improving" something until you finally ruin it.

reviewTitle: Muffled sound.  Smaller than implied on pics.
reviewDescription: OK this thing is easy to install and setup, they got that right.However it's the size of a large baseball, or small softball.So don't expect a large digital clock either.As to the muffled sound, it makes the computer woman's voice hard to understand at times.Edit:  I found Bass, Mid, Treble controls on the app.  Will play with those to see if it helps.A new user, so all for now.

reviewTitle: It's OK, kind of a pain to use
reviewDescription: While I do like the device, the software is atrocious. No offline features whatsoever (not even alarm cancellation so you need to unplug it to stop, so stupid). Settings never stick and I'm constantly reverting them.  Tap gesture is spotty when you need it and never works when you want it. Also hates enabled devices for whatever reason as it has a heck of a time pairing. It's nice but for those issues it's acceptable.

reviewTitle: I wanted this for the fan/ white noise
reviewDescription: I purchased this really for the box fan/ white noise. It won’t play the box fan it always wants me to buy something and it will play this ungodly loud noise in the white noise mix that wakes you up. It woke up my grandsons and scared them to boot! Not a fan (pun intended)

The volume up and down buttons are very hard to press. Also need to tap very hard to pause or resume a song played on the device.Bluetooth pairing is not that great and songs played through YouTube on mobile doesn't have good sound on this device

I love the look of it and the time display is perfect but it’s hard to get Alexa’s attention even after the app training and increasing the volume.  Increasing the volume only makes her talk louder, it doesn’t affect the listening for commend function.

reviewTitle: First time buyer and I'm in love
reviewDescription: First time I ever purchased these and I absolutely love them! Very easy to hook up very easy to use I highly recommend them for anybody especially first time Smart Home integrators.

reviewTitle: Increased from 2 GB to 20 GB wifi on phone
reviewDescription: I had trouble setting up my DOT ECHO and my call to AMAZON was forwarded to a help line. I was told that I had downloads that shouldn't have been done. They explained that for $100 they could clean out the things that were causing the issues and would be able to set up my DOT ECHO with a clean slate, not having to worry about anyone getting my passwords and info. I guess I was dupped, but thinking amazon support forwarded my call to them I thought it would be legit. My wifi usage went from using average 2 GB to 24 GB per month since they "supposedly" cleaned out my internet. Can someone help?

I have already purchased 4 of these amazing little "dots" whenever they went on sale. 2 with the clock display and 2 without. The sound is amazing, which is the main use for me, to listen to my music around the house. I don't have a "smart home" or anything like that to connect to it, but the music alone, plus getting the "daily brief" in the morning with the weather forecast, news and notifications about any amazon packages that were delivered is worth it for me.I'd like to add that one of the most useful things for me is to ask Alexa to play "my music", which was easily set to be my apple music library.  I have also set Alexa to announce tomorrow's weather every evening at 6:30pm and through the app, modified the "Good morning Alexa" prompt to remove the "fun fact" (which started repeating itself after a while), and to keep the weather for today, added the air quality today and the the daily brief, with the current news updates.

reviewTitle: Fun gift for parent who has everything
reviewDescription: Bought as a gift for elderly parents. Dad loves being able ask Alexia to play music. They also work a jumbo puzzle everyday and now they can just ask Alexa to spell a word without looking it up in a dictionary. It was easy to setup and now information is at their fingertips.

reviewTitle: works great and extends my eero wifi
reviewDescription: No complaints and works great. Extends my eero wifi as a bonus. Note that at each reboot, the thermometer feature needs to calibrate and might not be available for a few minutes.
Got this to replace my old MacBook on my nightstand for white noise & podcasts to fall asleep to.Works great and lots of volume stops so it's not too loud.

Great for setting reminders, finding out the weather, getting the answer to things like “how many cups in a quart?” Or “what date is Easter this year?”  Or “when is Taylor Swift’s birthday?”Simple to play music too.It understands my voice and my kids very accurately.Now we have 2!
I love my echo dot. The clock lets me see at night the time very well. It is program to answer, play music, weather etc that I need for the day
Easy to set up. Connects easily to my phone and I use it as an alarm as well as speaker. The light makes for an awesome night light as well.

For $29 this is hard to beat.  I use it as my alarm clock and to listen to news before going to sleep.  Sound quality is fine, at least for my purposes.  I do not use it for listening to music.  I like the clock.  I can just glance at it now instead of having to ask Alexa what time it is.  I wish it had been available in black, and I am not fond of the display's font.  But these are nit picks.

This is really cool. Works flawlessly. The setup was a breeze.  I purchased it mostly for my mother. She has trouble using her smartphone. Now, she can simply talk to the echo dot and get information from the internet without having to use her phone, only her voice like for example>>> Alexa, will it rain today? The other thing is my mother has arthritis really bad and it takes her a few minutes to get up and answer the door when someone rings the blink doorbell. Now, the Echo Dot will announce when someone is at the door and she can tell the device to answer the blink doorbell and speak to the person who is at the door. This is like so cool IMO! Amazon rocks. I just ordered another Echo for my bedroom. 5 stars all the way baby! 👍

I'm an old-school Gen Xer so anything that talks to me is great (remember Merlin?). I read about this online and the article said you could set it to talk like Samuel L. Jackson but alas, I have yet to see where that is possible. However, you can change the name with a few options and the voice/accent. It plays the sound for my TV through its speaker so I can have it sitting next to me and I don't have to strain to hear across the room or turn the volume up and annoy people (yes, I am that old). It'll take me a while to learn the bells and whistles. My kids and grandkids probably know more than me so I'm sure I don't know yet all the neat stuff it can do. I just enjoy asking for things like songs or the weather or recipes. It will send a recipe to my phone so I can have it on hand for cooking! As for it listening all the time, it has a microphone turn-off switch. This gadget so far makes this old lady happy.

I have two of the 3rd gen and was giving one of them to my step father so though I update my own.The ball is not bad, The time is nice and bright I have to have one with a clock. Was quick set up. I chose to do it in person and not through the ordering process. They gave me the option to set it up ahead of time.I will admit Alexa had spoiled my mom, step father, my son and me.We use it for every day reminders for taking medication. I am slowly working on my mom remembering to set timers when she bakes. I love the feature that lets you know when packages arrive. We always worry if we will miss a delivery.I have her working with a plug for my mom to turn on and off lights- she uses that a lot.I love the feature of "dropping in" while I am at work I can drop in on my son to make sure he is getting ready for school.All around Alexa has been a great addition to the house.

We have laptops, iPads, and phones…………..I didn’t realize Alexa should be a part of the threesome……why anyone asks? When your husband is watching a movie and says things like “who was she married to again”, or is reading the paper and he questions something…..he never asks me any longer…..my answer is ask Alexa ……as you see Alexa is right there next to his TV surround soundIf you don’t have these problems BUY IT ANYWAY…….it’s a great gift.  My husband is not a techie but Alexa does all the thinking for him. I recommend this to anyone.  Can’t believe it took me so long to jump on the bandwagon!  Super easy set up…..she literally walks you through the process.

reviewTitle: Super Impressed by the Echo Dot 5
reviewDescription: The biggest feature is the smart home assistant feature which I feel was not mentioned properly when considering buying this product. It does everything! I am 66 and needed help turning on and off things because I have about twenty remotes and things got messy and confusing. So I turned to Kasa smart plugs for each device and outlet which are excellent and purchased the Echo Dot 5 so that I could to tell the assistant what to turn off and on. I was able to change her wake up name to Echo which was a huge plus. The other alternative was Amazon, and of course Alexa but for me the name Echo was perfect. I have it tell me the weather or if there are any Amazon deliveries scheduled, turn on the news, tell me a joke, play music, sing to me or just about anything you could ask. When I am waking up in bed, I tell Echo to make coffee, turns on the coffee pot for 8 minutes and then shuts it off automatically and say's "Your Coffee is Ready". I also have it remind me to take out the garbage every Saturday at 4pm. I also have it remind me on the fly. For instance I will say remind me in 5 minutes that I have a chore to do and she says it without programming it in. Although It is easy to set up routines in the settings on your Alexa App on your phone. Best fifty dollar investment ever.

This device replaced a first generation Echo Dot and the performance improvements are enormous. Sound quality, voice recognition, elegance of design — Echo devices have come a long way since we last upgraded. The particular device, an intermediate choice between “blind” devices and those with a full screen, is perfect for us, the default clock giving way to timers when needed. It was time for an upgrade and this one was more bang for the buck than I had expected.

reviewTitle: Nice assistant, awesome sound but less sensible to some wake words than Alexa or Echo
reviewDescription: Pretty cool Alexa device, I got some home things configured to it already. I wanted to call it Ziggy but after many tries for it to get hear me I ended up surrendering and changing the wake word to Echo. Unless Ziggy is a word made for less sensitive cases to avoid being triggered with anything it needs to be improved... other wake words would be cool, even custom ones. The sound is incredible for its size and the app integration is very nice!

There's nothing I dislike about this product. It's so cool to have it on my nightstand in the bedroom. Love listening to the music anything I want to hear and it sounds super great love Alexa very pleased customer I must have. And another plus is the clock and the alarm when I need it

Super nice. Works great in the bedroom as a music alarm. Just tell alexa what you want! It does not have a battery back-up, but if the power goes out in the middle of the night, it will reset back to the true time when the power comes back on. And it will remember your alarm request. There is also a separate battery back-up available for it, if you want to buy it too.

reviewTitle: I gotta admit, I'm really hooked on Alexa Solutions - Echo Dot and Echo Show
reviewDescription: A few weeks ago I took delivery of an Echo Show.  I've added many smart devices and have created rooms, groups and routines within Alexa. These devices can be controlled by our Echo Show or Echo Dot.Focusing on the Echo Dot: By adding an Echo Dot in our "owners suite" (avoiding the previously used term for the same location), I've extended the Alexa functionality further.  The Dot has surprisingly good sound for it's size.  Not saying Bose quality, but very good.  We went with the Dot model with a clock to completely eliminate the need for an alarm clock in the room.  You can listen to iHeartRadio, Pandora, SiriusXM or Spotify on the Dot (or Show).  Depending upon the service, it will scroll artist and song info on the screen.  If you ask for the weather it provides you with the weather and scrolls the high and low temps on the Dot.  The Dot has a temperature sensor that you can query.  If you ask for the indoor temperature it averages the temp on a Nest thermostat and the Dot.  Or, you can ask for the individual temperatures.  You can also adjust the temperature settings on your Nest thermostat from your Dot (or Show).The only "negative" is with the brightness of the "screen".  The lights/dots are perfect when the room is illuminated (the dots are brighter).  When the room is less bright the dots are less bright.  In a dark room the dots are a little dimmer than we'd like.  I am going to play to see what settings are available to address this modest concern.Overall, I am very happy with our Echo Dot (and Echo Show)!

reviewTitle: Poor quality and difficult to return
reviewDescription: This was the first echo dot I had issues with - right out of the box, the setup process kept on failing even after hours of troubleshooting. The echo dots I purchased in 2016 might have sounded terrible but they never had any issues.I ended up returning the echo dot since I couldn’t get past the setup, and the return process was also difficult. I purchased the bundle with the “free” smart plug. Both devices needed to be returned to get a refund, but the shipping instructions were different for each. I brought them to the UPS store where they claimed I needed to pay for packing materials for the echo dot, even though the smart plug was just dumped in a garbage bag. For some reason I wasn’t given the option to return the devices to Whole Foods, which would have been much easier.

reviewTitle: If you ever change wifi networks, it's pretty much worthless
reviewDescription: Very difficult integration with other devices. Amazon likes to keep its own walled garden but doesn't do well integrating multiple devices or having multiple users. The device also does not change wifi, so if you ever have to upgrade a router, you're left with a brick.

reviewTitle: What a waste. Only works with music subscriptions
reviewDescription: Bought this to help me wake up in the mornings by playing my high-energy playlist at a predetermined time. I’ve been struggling with a sleep disorder and it’s too easy to snooze and sleep through alarms. “Try Alexa” they said. “You can schedule the playing of music” they said. After avoiding this unnecessary Alexa garbage for years I gave in for this single benefit. Joke’s on me… Amazon discontinued the ability to play music from your phone library years ago. It now only plays music from streaming services, because of course they want the steady and increase-friendly revenue from your music subscriptions. The only ways to play your own music library, if like me you’re a child of the download/iTunes era, are to manually connect to Bluetooth and pull up what you want to play, or to download some other app (also subscription based, naturally) to have that ability. So now I have this large circular decorative clock wasting space on my bedside table… anyone need an Echo? A very disappointing waste of money. I wish I’d done more extensive research before buying.

I absolutely hate this item .Its not a love/hate relationship- its a hate/hate more relationship. Disconnects constantly. Its in the SAME ROOM as the modem.  Ask to play music, it will for about 7 seconds. Play radion station?  Generally have to yell at this to get it to play anything. Find myself saying "you're useless!" The one I have in the kitchen- 2 rooms away- older model- plays just fine.  This one?  Piece of trash.

Thought it was a simple solution to adding surround sound to the frame  TV in my bedroom First I had to buy new fire stick. Okay.  When it works it sounds great, I’ve got a dot on each nightstand.Problem is, it works when it feels like. Worse still, it goes silent, and when you try to switch to us the TV speaker, it will constantly switch back to the echo and go silent.Also, I have the worst time in the Alexa app trying to pay from theses speakers, as a group, as a room, as a floor etc,  doesn’t matter.  I love technology when it’s affordable, but when it doesn’t work it defeats the purpose.  Money is money and I feel like I’ve totally wasted it.Super annoying.Super frustrating.

it turns itself down all the time-and I will have to turn it up MANY times a day and I have gone in the program both in my laptop and cell----it is no way as reliable as the old alexa-it will drop reminders and timers on its own---thank goodness I kept my old one

I ordered this on Prime day. It was already hell trying to get it delivered but when I got it, I tried for two hours to set it up, but I could never get it to connect to wifi via the alexa app, even after resetting the device, deleting and re-downloading the app, and a talking to customer service. I was sent a new device and the same thing is happening. I can't connect it to wifi. I have two laptops, two tvs, and a cellphone connected to my wifi without a problem, so it's not on my end. The app is updated.. My phone is updated, so Idk what the issue is. Im very disappointed and annoyed to be honest smh.

Delivery driver just threw package on concrete porch instead of placing it down. Echo Dot wouldn’t connect to WiFi no matter what including with help from Amazon customer service. Either it’s a dud or was damaged when thrown on the porch. Will update after replacement arrives.UPDATE: I have strong uninterrupted WiFi service. Second Echo Dot delivered  today absolutely WILL NOT connect to Wifi after every possible attempt. Forget it, I’m done buying Echo Dots and make due with what’s I have. These are terrible! My 3rd Gen Echo Dot is great but now I’m stuck running into the bedroom to talk to Alexa to turn the living room lights on. Oh well, I need the exercise.I DO NOT recommend 5th Echo Dot! 2 for 2 don’t connect to Wifi.

Really bad app experience. First, it wasn’t able to lookup any wifi networks. Worked around by disabling Bluetooth. Finally, it finds the wifi network but now says password is incorrect for the wifi (which is not).Amazon, please review basic app functionality before releasing!!!1star for now, already wasted couple of hours on this.

IT SEEMS IF YOU DON'T HAVE CELL SERVICE YOU CAN NOT ADD AN ALEXA TO YOUR ACCOUNT.  THE ALEXA CUSTOMER SERVICE COULD NOT PIGGYBACK MY MUSIC SERVICE FROM MY EXISTING ALEXA.  AS A RESULT, ALL I CAN DO IS RETURN IT, WHICH WAS NOT MY DESIRE.  I'M GUESSING AMAZON DOES NOT CARE. THEY CAN NOT DOWNLOAD THE ALEXA APP. TO MY COMPUTER.  SO MUCH FOR THE ELECTRONICS AGE!!

Want to listen to 1 artist? Alexa will EVERY TIME asks you if you want to subscribe to unlimited amazon music. And Alexa will have you listen to other artists that it deems similar to the one you requested to listen to.

reviewTitle: Not the best item to purchase
reviewDescription: This product only lasted 6 months before I started having issues.  I have tried returning it for a replacement, but the system will not let me.  Guess I am forced to purchase a second one not that its in my best interest.

Cons: 1) must be a liberal product. The only news sources are CNN CBS or NBC. 2) oh yea…you can play songs, but you have to buy an audio package for $4.99 in order to do so. I figured since I had 330 songs on my phone, that I’d be able to stream them thru the DOT. Nope. So unless you just want the weather or for her to answer simple questions, then this is for you.  Disappointed.
It stops all the time. My other black Dots are way better.

This device will only work with Apple Music and solo. I have other Alexa devices that it will not connect with and it will not connect with Spotify. Would not recommend if you use Alexa as anything more than an alarm clock.

reviewTitle: Me hace falta un foquito qué venía acompañado junto mi artículo
