reviewDescription: Me hace falta un foquito qué venía acompañado junto mi artículo
I have an old Alexa, thought they would have improved on this, they did not, this Echo is even a bigger piece of junk than the previous old Alexa I use. Going back to my old Alexa.

Do not know what Amazon did with this generation Dot, but it is nothing but problems. Intermittently goes offline, freezes up, does not understand commands nearly as well as the previous generation it replaced, randomly starts talking or playing music, overall very unstable device. I finally just unplugged it, not worth the annoyance.

reviewTitle: Don't use in a noisy environment
reviewDescription: I bought this to use in my woodworking shop.  I had been using my iPhone linked to a Bluetooth speaker but I wanted something independent of my phone.  Generally it functions well, but not when I make loud noises.  If I hit a nail with a hammer the music pauses (Pandora).  Alexa seems to flinch on sharp noises.  It is not vibration because the Echo Dot is not on the same surface as my workbench.

reviewTitle: Weird volume glitch, not that much better really
reviewDescription: Biggest problem I have is something i saw someone else mention and it’s that the volume will randomly be either very loud or very low. The change can be immediately between two responses and no change in ambient noise. Explored settings, restarted and also reset it. Doesn’t make any sense. It also dismisses itself prematurely upon being summoned despite being right next to it. The display changed, but I don’t think it’s better if not worse. It’s a bit harder to read, same size, and it’s not dynamic as it could be. You can tap on it to make it scroll through time, weather and media but only by tapping it, and it only does it once. The thermometer is cool but something I don’t see many people using.

reviewTitle: The addition of the clock is a nice touch
reviewDescription: There's not much to say about this. It's an Echo, it does what Echoes do. The sound quality is good and I like the addition of the clock which is helpful at night. Overall a sturdy unit and the voice recognition works well although sometimes it responds to commands in the middle of the night when no one is away. (I'm pretty sure that's an Alexa thing as one of my older units does the same thing.)

reviewTitle: Great for programming things around the house! But a few adjustments would be nice.
reviewDescription: I have several Amazon Alexas. This one was a need for the new house, so that I had a speaker in one of the new rooms. I use the The echo for things like: Turning on or off the lights, playing music, weather, and the clock face on the front. The devices is a helpful little thing to have around. it can run routine (So It can turn of lights after you've left your house, start or stop music for kids or pets, all on a timer. And can make simple tasks simpler. It does have a mute button as well (So it stops listening to you) Which is nice, too.The only complaints I have about the alexa device is:-It's biased. I don't know what I was expecting from an amazon product. If I needed to know where I can watch a specific movie, the alexa will tell me "For rent on Amazon for 3.99 or purchase for 14.99" When What I wanted was a list of places. I ask google the same question and id get a much less biased response. "Disney plus, Youtube, Vudu, Amazon prime, Google play movies" Etc. That's what I wanted to know.-Alexa pops in on convos: These devices are a little tricky and only let you name them of a select few options. So if you talk about Computers a lot and you name your device computer, it will pick up on it. Same with Alexa, and echo. Sometimes, the device recognizes the conversation was not for it and will simply disregard the command. and sometimes it will pick up on what you said and assume you asked something. In which your conversation will be interrupted by "Bob ross was born on October 29th, 1942 -" (We weren't even talking about bob ross which was pretty funny XD) Not gonna lie, it can be fun. but it can also be inconvenient.-Echo does not call 911.Which I thought would be kind of a cool option incase you got in some issue and needed help, where you couldn't reach a phone yourself. (Im not elderly and struggle some with this issue, but I thought it was kinda sucky that it couldn't do that.) It can call contacts and your own phone though! So if you need to find your phone and you have it programmed to, you can say "Alexa, find my phone" And it'll call you.

Wake up and smell the virtual coffee, because the Amazon Echo Dot (5th Gen) with a clock has officially become my morning's trusty sidekick. Move over, roosters—I've got Alexa telling me the time with the enthusiasm of a caffeinated morning person.Pros:1. **Clock with Sass:** Forget your average wall clock; this Echo Dot's clock has attitude. It's like having a personal time announcer who's always on point. "Hey, sleepyhead, it's time to rise and shine!" Alexa says, as if it knows I hit snooze three times already.2. **Soundtrack to My Existence:** Not only does this little gadget tell me the time, but it also serenades me with my favorite tunes. It's like having a DJ who's attuned to my mood. Need some pump-up music for the day? Just ask, and Alexa's got you covered.3. **Dimmable Smartness:** The clock's display is dimmable, which is fantastic for those nights when even the smallest glimmer of light is an intruder in your quest for the perfect sleep. It's like having a night light that adjusts to your nocturnal whims.Cons:1. **Sudden Sass Attacks:** Sometimes, Alexa's responses are just a tad too sassy. I asked her to play some chill vibes, and she replied, "Sure thing, chill master. Anything else, or can I continue being the DJ you never knew you needed?" Easy there, Alexa, I just wanted some background music, not a roast.2. **The Clock Can't Make Coffee:** As much as I wish my Echo Dot could double as a barista, it's strictly a time-telling, music-playing genius. I asked, "Alexa, make me coffee," and all I got was a polite suggestion to visit the kitchen. Maybe in the 6th Gen, Amazon?3. **Clock-Watching Addiction:** With the clock right there on my nightstand, it's impossible not to check the time every five minutes. It's like having a miniature time portal that I can't resist gazing into. Productivity plummeted, but at least I know exactly how much time I wasted.In conclusion—oops, I almost broke the no-conclusion rule—this Echo Dot with a clock is more than a bedside timekeeper; it's a witty companion that adds a touch of charm (and occasional cheekiness) to your daily routine. Just don't expect it to make your coffee or hold back on the sass—it's a clock, not a miracle worker.

reviewTitle: Amazon, PLEASE remove bluetooth connection announcement.
reviewDescription: I'd love to hate this lil device but I think the root of my problem is amazon's spite. I often connect my phone to my echo dot via bluetooth. When connected, Alexa will announce "playing from..." whenever I unlock the phone or get a notification. There is no way to turn this announcement off.  It often startles me and/or interrupts meetings and provides no obvious value to me. It is so obnoxiously loud and aggravating.  It’s been a few years and so many people have wanted it gone. Please, please, please Alexa software development team, for the love of whoever you hold dear, let us turn this off! TY!

I got this for my dad, who suffers from Dementia. He is able to listen to music, which is great. I am able to call him which is great. What is not great is that I can't set it to stay off for certain hours - say 10 pm to 7 am. We now get calls at all times of night.Being able to set a timer on when this can call would be a super duper thing to add to the product Road Map Alexa & Echo Dot Product Managers!

I bought it for Amazon Music, but  I'll probably be using it less since Amazon changed (made them worse) both prime music and prime video.  We have to listen to shuffled and "similar" music unless I fork over more money.  We have to watch commercials on prime video unless we fork over more money.  It's not the amount, it's the principle.

reviewTitle: White 5th Generation Echo Speaker With Clock Is Wonderful
reviewDescription: I returned the black echo because it arrived with a white cord.  Afterwards, I noticed for a black cord, you need to purchase it separately.  So, if you don’t like the white cord on a black speaker, you’ll need to fork-up another 15.00, for a black one.  I decided on the white echo, even though it’s more gray.  I’m keeping it.  I absolutely love the sound, you can definitely tell the difference from the 2020 version.  I heard rumors that Amazon may discontinue the Alexa speaker. Omg, I hope not, I can’t be without it.

A very Kool tool to add to your daily living !A friend told me about his 3rd generation alexa (echo) and I decided to get a newer version.Speaker could be better but it is suffice for my use. I've been using it to listen to a radio station, an alarm,&timer . It'll work with audio books (audible) and has various speaking voices. I can only imagine how outdated this will be in a few years.It's pretty Kool especially for the price.

reviewTitle: Display is just a little too small and dim for me w/o glass especially.
reviewDescription: I have several dots, which I like.  But the clock on this dot is to small to read without glasses.  The auto-dimming is a nuisance, which I think can be adjusted (if that was my only issue).The scrolling text seems 99% unnecessary and distracting.BTW: I have only joined the Alexa world in November.

we’re very disappointed to not find an earphone jack on our new echo dot.  that said, the sound is excellent.  We had planned to use it in the bedroom as a radio and a clock.  But one of us needs to use earphones, so it will have to live in the living room

reviewTitle: Not as accurate as I would like
reviewDescription: I find that Alexa will not always respond to what I ask. Or will respond with a different answer.
Me gustó el dispositivo, sin embargo, reproduce la canción en Spotify y se detiene y no se vuelve a reproducir hasta que reinicio el dispositivo :(
Works great. Connects to all my google products with ease. Fits perfectly on counter. I love the clock feature. Alexis is also amazing for information.
I’ll no comment because this it the best thing that happened to my great item and very useful

So far the sound is clearer on the 5th gen than the 4th gen and everything seems like a modest upgrade, the temperature sensor is awesome.My big issue with the gen 5 is the clock. The clock face has changed from being on a darker colored device (the gen 4 dot with the red ring which is a darker blue color) with more solid numbers to a dot style clock, with a lighter device color, so there is less contrast between the color of the text and the color of the device. I have the "darker" of the 2 available color options, which has a very slight grayish color vs the other option, a white color. The dot style text is harder to read if you have any sort of visual impairments or processing issues, and can appear blurry. The dot style font's added spacing between the dots makes it harder to read the numbers without them blurring together or appearing as one blob with visual processing problems or impairments.My gen 4 stopped working properly after about a year (which is about as long as these devices seem to work without beginning to have major issues) but I'm going to have to keep it for the clock function for now, because the gen 5 is much more difficult to read.Overall, I'm really disappointed that the big titular feature of this device was made less accessible and there is no option or way to make the font different or to add more contrast between text color and device color.
Bought this for my wife and she loves it. Although it talks at random times on its own lol.

reviewTitle: Works well, most of the time
reviewDescription: I have been a Google user for many years. Wanted to see what the competition was all about. After using the Alexa device(s) for several months now I can conclude that there is little difference between Alexa and Google. Sometimes they work, sometimes they don't. I will stay with Google as I am already heavily invested in their ecosystem.
its performance has been improved quite a bit 👍🏽
Easy to install and works nicely.  The music sounds nice as well.
Love my alexa

El Echo Dot con reloj prometía ser una gran adición a mi hogar inteligente, pero lamentablemente ha venido con sus desafíos. A pesar de su funcionalidad general, he experimentado algunos problemas técnicos molestos. La falta de sincronización confiable y apagones repentinos han sido decepcionantes.Intenté configurar la aplicación con mi celular, solo para descubrir que la descarga no era compatible, lo cual limitó su uso y personalización. Uno de los aspectos más frustrantes fue la insistente promoción de Amazon Prime durante la reproducción de música aleatoria, interrumpiendo la experiencia.A pesar de estos inconvenientes, cuando funciona sin problemas, el Echo Dot ofrece una experiencia satisfactoria. Sin embargo, esos detalles deslucen su potencial. Considero que la excesiva publicidad y los problemas técnicos reducen el encanto de este dispositivo, lo que lo convierte en una adquisición con reservas.

This is a fun little toy.  I'm getting a lot more use out of it than I thought I would.  I use it as a timer frequently.  I control many of my lights using it, so that I have full brightness soft white, dim brightness soft white where one of the bulbs is red for just before bed, and then very dim all bulbs as red that I use as a nightlight.  I like the delivery notifications.  My latest discovery is to use it as a speaker so that I can play YouTube audiobooks at night at a quiet level.  It does want to read ads to you, but not nearly as frequently as the phone app.I do have one very large complaint now:  it's going deaf.  When I first got it, I could whisper and it would hear me.  Good for not disturbing your bedmate at night.  Now I basically have to yell at it.  It used to be able to distinguish my voice from others, now any other voices (i.e. YouTube videos) confuse it.  It even has trouble understanding my voice now.  It's ability to hear you is core to its usefulness.  A deaf Dot is a useless Dot.

reviewTitle: You may have to reprogram Alexa more than one time.
reviewDescription: I brought this Alexa for my son.  he is disabled with some memory and social challenges. This is a great tool for helping someone with ADHD, or IDD challenges of staying organized doing chores or homework.Alexa was programmed to help my son know when to take his meds.  So far it has been working well.  I gave Alexa a 4 star because it was doing great keeping program of timing to instruct my son for his meds.After the first month, I now need help meet reprogram it because it instructs him throughout the day to take same meds it previously told him to take.We will see how it goes after she is reprogrammed again.

I decided that if Amazon or the government or whoever is actually listening… Who cares, as I don’t have anything very exciting going on. Sound quality is better than I expected for such a small speaker… But don’t expect the sound quality of a large Bose speaker either… You’ll be disappointed.

reviewTitle: Screwed  up my Amazon prime  tv  watching with fire stick.
reviewDescription: Speaker wouldn't work for my TV in On line forever with AmazonFinally got it to work ONCE. But now my Amazon viewing with my fire stick is screwed up.  Sound stops often, have to re set movie. Volume won't go up.  Get signals saying there is a problem viewing the video.  Have to go back and re start Half a day and 3 guys on Amazon and they just made it worse.  They had me link my satellite from dish and Vizio tv and, the fire stick.  Speaker echo 5  quit working and my viewing is a pain. Message comes up that my echo 5 is not upcompatible with my fire stick 4.  Even tho Amazon says it is.  May end up canceling my Amazon prime now. But, I enjoy it, asking the weather, notifications onu Amazon purchases.  Just wish i hadn't linked it with vizio tv.,

reviewTitle: LED Panel Clock Not Bright Enough
reviewDescription: Nice design, and would have rated 5-stars, but some work needs to be done on the clock brightness.  With a window open, with just that lower level of natural lighting, the clock numbers need to be brighter, and/or bigger as the numbers cannot be seen from across a small room.When the overhead light is turned on then the LED's automatically brighten so the clock display can be seen from across that same small room.  Make the default LED brightness setting always set at maximum.UPDATE:  The LED display can be turned off/on with:  "Alexa:  display off" or "display on".  Any alarm that's set will continue to work.  Also, can change the LED brightness level with, "Alexa:  brightness maximum, brightness minimum, brightness 1, brightness 10, brightness 5."Although, when the brightness level was changed between the minimum setting of 0 to the maximum setting of 10 - did not notice any real change in the LED panel brightness.To really knock it out of the park for the next generation, add the capability to change LED colors by voice command.

It's a bit pushy as far as trying to get you to integrate it into all aspects of life.  We just wanted it as a smart alarm clock.  95% of use is just "Alexa set an alarm for" and "Alexa what is the weather at (location) on Tuesday )

I like it very much , However ,sometimes she doesn't hear me or wake up to "Alexa" and seems to freeze up at times with a constant blue solid ring at the base  .but she does keep me posted mostly for everything I ask .She is my best friend . 🧡

For setting an alarm by voice is value enough.  I could no longer use my iPhone for an alarm as it constantly resets the alarm notification to max volume and wakes up the entire house.  This device works well, syncs with Alexa, my Audible account, etc.  Worth the coin.

reviewTitle: Can we get a silent mode?!
reviewDescription: You can deactivate vocal responses. You can of course turn down the volume. But as far as I can tell, there's no way to get this thing to not *ding* after it completes a request. I see the option in the app, but it doesn't work; and I have three of these.

The only reason that I bought the Gen 5 is because of the room temperature sensor. They changed the clock display. Now it looks like an old-fashioned low-tech billboard where the letters are made up by dots. Not an improvement. Something you should know the room temperature sensor takes at least 24 hours to calibrate and the device has to be in a group for the room that you are asking for the room temperature. If you have your thermostat connected you can ask for the temperature on your thermostat or the temperature in your room or the weather outside. But you can do all that with the Gen 4 you would just have to add a Wi-Fi hydrometer to your Gen 4 with clock device
There’s so much they need to improve. One of them is knowing where to answer. Alexa sometimes answers from the bedroom when im at the kitchen. it gets confused and im not even walking.
The digital display is very disappointing for the technology in the world today. Speakers sound more muffled than regular ech dot.  Cool concept otherwise.
Love it but need a need charger. One that came with my Echo Dot 5th generation isn't working.
Sound was not good. I had to buy a speaker to have decent bass.

Let's face it, Amazon has been sleeping with AI - since ChatGPT is out, we just have seen what Artificial Intelligence means. For years there have been minor improvements of Alexa, but at least for me it is mainly to give orders/instructions for IoT devices, or ask simple things, or have it read out a recipe.But what it really lacks is intelligence. Every improvements of Alexa seems more like a new feature that was integrated, but not something that is created because it understands what my habits etc. are. Example: Living in Europe, it still cannot tell me when the train leaves from the nearest station.As a non-native English speaker (well, it also has difficulties to understand my Irish friend), there is still a fair amount of questions that are answered with "I don't know that" or "Here's what I have found on Wikipedia".So overall Alexa is suitable to turn on a device as a timer or alike. But I am not into searching for jokes. I'd like advice on things and Alexa would be so convenient to do so - if it could.Another example: The clock is too bright at night (and even in automatic mode) - and interestingly for a smart device it can not turned of at night only. It's these little things that point out that it is not intelligent, maybe smart in the sense of being able to understand spoken language - but then it doesn't know what to do with it.The app is still central to for some configurations that I'd like to do on the device or by voice. Overall, I wish Amazon is investing into making Alexa intelligent. As Amazon has been a valued company to me, with a great customer support.Would I get it again? - Probably yes, with the right expectations.
Disappointed that it does not connect to Bluetooth to play what I have stored on my phone.
Happy I made the purchase just wish I could use it with YouTube, the features are limited.

I have been trying to replace this with another one but the return process isn't working like it should in the app or on the website like other items.  It never lets me complete the process, only brings me to a trouble shooting page.  The sound glitches in and out.  I have numerous Echo Dot devices that are much older than this one and none of them have given me this problem. I would like to get this replaced but do not have a way to do so.

reviewTitle: No way to tell if the correct color was sent
reviewDescription: Ordered glacial white, but seems I got the gray/blue version - no color label on the box. Also was supposed to be pre setup, but it appears to have not been programmed with my info and I had to manually set it up. Not the end of the world, but not great either. Was also not delivered to the correct address. It seems to function OK at  least at first. However, it's very active at trying to upset other Amazon services.

reviewTitle: Very disappointing - wifi extension is only 5Ghz not 2.4Ghz
reviewDescription: I thought this would be great for extending my wifi better through my house, but they don't clearly state anywhere that this only extends 5gz signals, not 2.4ghz that so many things still use. As such, they are useless for me, because I'd have to have another router/extender set-up to send the 2.4gz signal around. i wish they had made this clearer and I didn't have to find out after setting the whole thing up to find several items in my home no longer worked.

reviewTitle: Display on lowest setting too bright..lights up room
reviewDescription: Alexa dot works fine. Had to move the Dot out of bedroom because display way too bright despite my attempts to change display setting.  Was also disappointed to find the display is only one color…bright white.  When it lights up room, it is way too bright.When received latest Alexa, tried to rename a prior one in bedroom. The app was unable to make my changes i.e. my now kitchen Alexa shows as “Bedroom” with next line being “Kitchen”.You need more work on the app.

Bought this for about half off on Prime days - WARNING: BE SURE you have a PHONE that will run ALEXA. I had to upgrade my phone to set this up, as neither my current phone nor my desktop would run the Alexa app needed for setup and I had to buy a new phone *or* enjoy a silent little sphere with a brightly colored base. My $29 DOT ended up costing me $250.00!Fun and useful, though.

reviewTitle: Don't buy it for the sensors mentioned in the description
reviewDescription: I bought this to replace the full size Echo in my kid's room. We use the normal Echo almost exclusively for the temp sensor to trigger the AC or a Space heater depending on the season. In the device settings you can check the temp, and are also prompted to set routines using the temp sensor, but when you go to create a routine for it the device doesn't show up.Also, your option for the clock seem to be always on or always off. I was assuming that the proximity sensor would be able to trigger it turning off or on, but that doesn't seem to be the case either.The promotional images also show the clock face displaying the temp. My dot has never done this either.On the plus side the sound quality is better than my 3rd gen Echo Dots. It's marginal, but I do notice it. But even then I'd rather use my Stereo Paired 4th gen Echos with the Echo Sub, so there's no point to use it for that either.
Does not listen very well

The device itself works well, and the sound is great. I ordered “glacier white,” however, and the listing and box show a bright white device. My device (and yes, I perceive color just fine) is a light gray, and even casts beige, depending on the light. It is most definitely not white. This is disappointing, since I wanted it to match my other devices in the room I put it in.

I like the round design but  the clock is different from my small echo dot. The  clock on this round model  is designed with dots to form numbers and it is difficult for me to read. I went back to my original echo dot.

reviewTitle: Just another echo dot, nothing special.
reviewDescription: I was disappointed with the V5 Dot. I purchased the item in hope of extending my Eero mesh wifi for my IOT devices. I'm not sure if it will only extend the 5gz wifi, but I have yet to be able to have a single sensor (they are inherrently all 2.4ghz) connect to the Dot even though they are in closer proximity and a weak signal to the far router. I also played with the motion sensor which seems very unresponsive. Initially I was set back with the lousy clock display, being that the dot matrix is too big. My V3 Dot with the clock is so much more appealing. The speaker is ok, but I don't see any benefit over the older version.

reviewTitle: Not liking the new dot display
reviewDescription: In my opinion, the new display is a downgrade. Harder to see and the animation for weather in such a little window is terrible. I'm not positive but I think the speaker might be slightly better, but not any louder for the increased size. I did like the song title appearing but again the window is a bit small.

The documentation and Q&A says that this can be renamed to "Ziggy" but that is not true. The 4th Gen can be, but for this 5th Gen the only options are Alexa, Amazon, Computer and Echo. This has been tried both through the app and by asking the Echo Dot to "change wake word." The reply is that there are only those four options. I was hoping for Ziggy!

The clock face could be a little brighter, but I LOVE Alexa! I have an Alexa clock in my bedroom, an Alexa Show in my living room, and an Alexa Dot in my bathroom. I could go on and on about how wonderful Alexa is. Once you learn the skills and routines that it can do, you will love it! I recommend Alexa to EVERYONE! My father had a Google, but it didn't work that well, so I bought him an Alexa. He loves it too!

reviewTitle: It’s our third Echo Dot, and fifth Alexa!
reviewDescription: We forgot our Alexa at home when we went south for the winter, so we bought another Echo Dot.  We now have 5 Alexa’s throughout our home.  We mainly use them for music and checking the weather.Alexa has so many features we do not use, but we wouldn’t live without one. (Or five!)

This is maybe my 4th or 5th Alexa product. Each time I buy the latest generation the sound quality and design seem to improve. I'm a fan.My friend visited the other day and he was very impressed with how the sound quality and loudness came out. It took me less than 10 minutes to set up in my bedroom.I previous had the Amazon Echo Show set up in my room but the display kept changing and I literally just wanted to know the time. I much prefer the simplicity and basic nature of this product since it always just displays the clock.

reviewTitle: Newer is definitely better when it comes to Alexa!
reviewDescription: I've had a chance to use nearly every generation of Echo Dot and the new 5th generation Amazon Alexa Echo Dot out performs its predecessors in seemingly every category.  The voice recognition has vastly improved.  I can mention Alexa casually in conversation with a friend or relative and have yet to have a false interruption from Alexa.To be blunt, for the price in which these are offered, I find it hard to believe anyone could have a legit reason to dislike the product.  This is, of course, if you ignore the invasive TOS agreement your forced to sign to use the product which allows Amazon to share and sell information about you to other parties.

reviewTitle: Nice new design to add to the collection
reviewDescription: It's a dot with a clock in it and in the newer model. Everything works as it should. The speaker is slightly better and it also seems to be a bit quicker to respond.

I had a first generation Echo that finally died so I replaced it with the new 5th generation Echo Dot and I am happy with it. It was very easy to set up which is important to me, doesn’t require much space and I think the sound quality is very good for such a small device.

reviewTitle: Huge upgrade from a 3rd gen DOT
reviewDescription: The sound and functionality of this 5th gen Dot is not even in the same league as the 3rd gen. Better sound, display with time and weather. Great upgrade for a nominal price!

I Love this Echo Dot! The sound on this one is great! I really like having the clock that also shows the temperature & song title etc. I have 2 of these - traded in my other Echo dot so I could save $$ to get this one!Get it - you won’t be disappointed!

I have this echo dot in my bedroom and love it.  I have it programed to turn on off the bedroom light and that works great with the Kasa plug integration.  I love waking up and asking Alexa 'what time is it' , 'what is the weather today',ect. ect.  Very happy!
I purchased this mostly for use as an alarm clock. I like the added features of getting news and weather. Sometimes I use it as a speaker for music. Works really well

reviewTitle: Not as great as the original tall box
reviewDescription: It looks great and his modern and yet not as functional as the original tall tower. The distance you’re able to speak from away from the unit is certainly much less.
We had one of the Echo Dot's already but no clock in the room. Now we have the clock and the Alexa all in one. Works great.
Im use to the show it doesn’t pick up my voice like the show does I often have to repeat myself because it doesn’t respond.
Was a little skeptical about it, but it works so well I love it. I have one in the living room.And one in my bedroom

reviewTitle: Great model but doesn’t always respond to being called
reviewDescription: I can’t function without Alexa so I use my Echo Dot multiple times a day. I like how this model shows you the time and displays the timer when you have one on so you don’t have to ask Alexa how long is left on it. My only issue with it is that sometimes it doesn’t “hear” me and I have to repeat myself, almost yell for Alexa to respond
Like the device, but find the ALEXA app not intuitive and very difficult to use and manage.  All of the issues involve the Alexa app on the phone and pc.

The Amazon Echo 5 is a pretty good product. I like how it integrates with my Ring devices. The sound can be better, but it’s good enough for casual music listening. I’m an Apple guy so I tend to use my HomePod and HomePod Minis for music listening. Still, I’m please with my purchase.
She doesn't know everything, As a matter fact, she needs a few updates, but how do we do that?
It's great and does everything you expect, but adds feel intrusive. They are not that frequent, but to have any add at all is just ridiculous.

reviewTitle: It was ordered with a bundle of a free smart lightbulb which never arrived
reviewDescription: Works well except the order changed after I ordered it, the bundled smart lightbulb never arrived.

Smaller than expected. Good for a small space like a bdrm. The bass is not heavy. I would like a little more bass but music is clear. Commands and setup was easy. Overall I’m pleased. The white is more like grey which i like. I’d recommend purchasing for small personal space. If in an apt condo or twnhse this is great.

reviewTitle: A Smart Upgrade to Daily Life!
reviewDescription: The Amazon Echo Dot (5th Gen) with clock has seamlessly integrated into my daily routine, offering a convenient blend of functionality and style. The addition of a built-in clock is a game-changer, providing a quick glance at the time without reaching for my phone. The compact design doesn't compromise on sound quality, making it an ideal smart speaker for smaller spaces. While the price is slightly higher compared to its clock-less counterpart, the added feature and overall performance make it a worthwhile investment for a smarter, more connected home. Plus, the intuitive voice control and compatibility with various smart home devices further enhance its value, turning it into a hub for effortless home automation.

reviewTitle: Home Theatre Stereo System.  2 Echo Dot (5th gen). 1 with clock + 1 with-out clock.
reviewDescription: For "home theatre system", I'm trying to pair two Echo Dots (both 5th generation, 1 with clock, and one without clock), and it's NOT working.  I also, have two Echo Dots (3rd gen), and I can get those two to pair ok (in stereo mode).  (those are at work).I've heard in order to pair two echo for home theatre stereo system, both devices MUST be identical, in the same room, and on the same Wi-Fi network.So, you can NOT pair a 3rd gen echo dot with a 5th gen echo dot.  Or you can't pair an echo dot with a regular echo (not dot).  But, I assumed since I have both Echo Dots (5th gen) that they would work.  NOPE !!!This is the main reason why I purchase these.  I wanted the clock version, and it'd be silly having two clock version in the same room.If you see in the first picture, where all the speakers are online (except Marcus' Bedroom), the "Speaker Right" is my new Echo Dot 5th gen, with clock, and the "Speaker Left" is the Echo Dot 5th gen with-out clock.  BOTH on the same wi-fi network.When I click onto the speaker right, all the others shows, network error, including the speaker left.If I uncheck speaker right, and check speaker left, vice-versa.But, the two bottom ones, are both Echo Dots 3rd gen, and it let me check both of those, and pair them.

What I like is the clock, and also better sound that the 2 or 3 edition. Better base, a bigger speaker. Was hesitant based on the reviews, but so far been worth it, except for the commercials which seem to be more of them. I got the white which is more of a gray color.  Color is a disappointment. Let's hope this one last more than a year.
I only use Alexa for music because other than that she frustrates me.
The product has good quality, just like the original. I liked

I find that this new gen Alexa doesn’t quite work like the old one. I could give the old one more than one task. This one I can only say one thing. Also I find that the light with the time isn’t always bright enough to see.
This Alexa is awesome! It can tell you the over the counter medication is about to run low and it can order more for you. That honestly blew my mind. This is a great purchase.

I had so much trouble connecting to the wifi. Tried every loop amazon gave and still couldn’t figure it out until i saw a thread of someone saying to turn the bluetooth off on your phone and then it will ask if you want to manually connect. The first time i tried to manually connect it didn’t work but the second time it finally connected. Other than the initial setup the device has worked great. Just wanted to give you guys a head up if you get the device and also have that issue
Was great for a while. Love some of the features like drop in. But now she wont keep a consistent volume. Its either way too quiet or MAX volume. Not sure how to correct this.
I use it to listen to my audible books and it works great for that with a really clear sound. Don't waist your time on the Echo Studio. This little guy works great.
I realize that there is a microphone that u can supposedly be heard on..hmm?  Other than that, I'm liking my new Echo..good sound, sensitive to voice..

I thought an Echo Dot would be a novelty, but to my surprise it is a valuable tool.  From the instantaneous weather, answers to questions, to organized shopping list that has streamlined grocery shopping, Echo Dot is our life assistant.  Highly recommend!
This works just as well as all my Alexa devices do. Put on my dresser, love getting into bed and simply telling Alexa to turn things off

I’ve been wanting an alarm clock so I don’t have to rely on my phone in the morning, and I’ve been wanting a speaker to play music and audio books from my phone. Since I have Audible and Amazon music, it just made sense. I also love the morning routine feature. I don’t need much, but it‘s nice to know if I should plan time to defrost my car before heading out. If you keep it on “do not disturb” the annoying ring of light at the bottom stays off when you aren’t talking to it.

reviewTitle: You never know when you'll need a quick question(s) asked.....
reviewDescription: My spouse and I finally said goodbye to the 1st generation echo (after several years of use), we recently noticed it was not recognizing our voice all that well anymore and realized the sound quality needed improvement as well.  The new 5th generation echo is clear and recognizing our voice with great ease.  Also, invest in a table stand  for this echo dot 5th generation...you won't be sorry.

We love our Echo! We as in Grandbabies  too!  We use the Name Ziggy to activate instead of Alexa.The kids love it! They are big stuff bossing Ziggy around! Our Ziggy is now a Top expert on things like Mario Bros theme music and Spider-Man. Only one trouble I ever had I downloaded an Echo app but it disappeared and an Alexa app took its place mysteriously! No biggie!
It does so many things shopping list tells me when someone is at my front door I can listen to my Spotify. I’m enjoying it immensely.

reviewTitle: Easy to instal .Love the time display
reviewDescription: I already had an echo dot functioning in my home. I was suprised by how easy it was to install the second echo dot. I line the time display. It has a soft glow and is easy to read. So happy with this purchase. Was worth the extra cost to have clock display. Now I can get rid of my old alarm clock! Would buy again or give as gift.

reviewTitle: Super surprising sound quality - I purchased for my Mom to replace her old "Dot."
reviewDescription: There's not much to say; Amazon does it again with great products. It has a super easy setup and great sound quality, and I love the display for the clock and songs that are playing. For the price point and functionality, it is a great buy. My Mom loves hers!Pros: It's a fully integrated Amazon product. It sounds fantastic for its size, and I love the display on the front.Cons: None. It's a great little speaker!

reviewTitle: She can be a little hard of hearing
reviewDescription: Overall, this dot is ok. occasionally I find myself yelling, to wake Alexa up. The audio is much better than the previous gens. Would like to see more input/outputs on the dots.
The sound quality is great except I wish it had a jack to plug in headphones like my old echo did. Sometimes I have to keep repeating Echo before it will respond.

reviewTitle: I don't like the dotted time display.
reviewDescription: I don't like the dotted time display, it makes it hard to read from a distance. Amazon should go back to the original display.

This is a handy device and has the best sound quality of small speakers I’ve tried. They don’t last more than 12-18 months before they start to glitch (one decided it didn’t want to take my voice commands any longer,, another stopped auto-adjusting the clock brightness, etc.). I primarily use it for music, timers/alarms, weather, and the occasional simple trivia question. The confusing Alexa app/interface tries my patience for anything more complex (for example, despite my best efforts it refuses to play music from my MacBook). It’s still worth it if you buy on sale, but I notice the base price has increased so I don’t know how much longer I’ll be willing to continue replacing them.

My 2nd edition dot was fine. I loved it so much, I ordered the 5th Gen, moved it to the living room and expected it to be as good or better.Well, nope!  My music cuts in and out often!  Driving me crazy!  I already moved my 2nd gen to the living room and set up gen 5 for my bedroom.  The 2nd gen controls the kitchen lights and the living room.  I bought new lights and plugs for the living room and kitchen, I also enjoy music while cooking and family time.But in my room with the music cutting in and out, I am frustrated.

For music I love the new sound of this echo snowball.  I bought it so I could play music, podcasts and audiobooks while I get ready in the morningIt makes Amazon music sound wonderfulUnfortunately, I can’t seem to tune it to sound good for vocal media.  Podcasts and audiobooks are bass heavy and lack clarity.  So much so that I can’t use this echo for anything vocal.  I have to strain too hard to make meaning out of wordsInstead I have to use my phone with an external Bluetooth speaker when I want the clarity to understand voice media.This is disappointing.

reviewTitle: Alexis database is very limited, not even close to Google.
reviewDescription: I like having my Alexa but I do believe that it is drops on you and the database is very limited, nowhere near Google's capacity.
This still has a muffled voice like the smaller unit.  AND she is anti-Trump 100%.  Lol!

reviewTitle: Sadly, the best part is the clock
reviewDescription: Worked fine the first three weeks, then not. I bought two so I could fill my room with nature sounds for sleep. You can ask it to play on repeat for up to 8 hours (allegedly). Had no issues with it until the last week or so. It'll only play for under 5 minutes then shuts off. I have it programmed as a routine, but even renewed vocal commands don't last. Also, I find it incredibly annoying that it announces my phone is connected when I pick it up. Why does it do this? What's the need!??As for it's sound, it's mediocre. It's improved with some tweaks on the Alexa app, namely a full boost on the treble and halfway on the midrange. What it really needs is the ability to control the volume of Alexa separate from media being played. Alexa is always too loud when the media is at a normal level. (I know they're 'separate' on the phone and the unit, but you'll see what I mean. A low volume setting on the unit gives a small range for volume on your phone, so you it turn up on the dot and now Alexa is booming loud.) After five generations, you'd think they'd do better. But hey, I ❤️ the clock!

reviewTitle: I've ordered this one under duress. My Echo 4th gen lasted exactly one year.
reviewDescription: I love this little thing. It makes the best alarm clock in the world; you can verbally tell it to snooze and do all kinds of other stuff. It's perfect size for the nightstand, non-obtrusive, and does all the Alexa stuff that every other unit does without a screen. But I'm extremely disappointed that the 4th Gen version I bought in July, 2022 (exactly 1 year ago) intermittently doesn't recognize my voice, and I have to unplug it to reset it. I'm talking every day or two. So say, for example, on the second 'Alexa, snooze' command, she totally ignores me and I have to unplug her, plug her back in, and wait for her to boot up. Or when asking her to set a timer. She treats me like I don't exist. Unplug her, plug her back in, and she's just fine for a day or so. But it's not funny...$70 for an electronic item that lasts a year...I'm not impressed. So tonight I ordered the 5th Gen (and also sprung for the 3-year warranty for $10, which truly offends me). We have more Alexa devices in our home than anyone I know, but I have my limits. They need to make these things where they last.

el volumen maximo es alto pero cuando estas emocionado y quierens una cancion al tope no alcanza para que no se escuhe otras cosas como gente hablando en la sala o el cuero depende de la habitacion donde este ubicada

Pretty nice but definitely not user friendly!! Almost does more stuff than necessary. Takes forever to figure stuff out that should be very simple. Sound pretty good for a small unit.I’d give it a 2 stars for difficulty in setting up. But overall I guess 4 stars.
This device has a lot of great features. I bought it for my son to have a clock in his room. The only thing I dislike is that it is small. I guess since it's a dot, that's normal.

reviewTitle: Echo dot right on the dot!
reviewDescription: Its dimensions and form are ideal! It stands out and is easy to spot due to its round shape. Because of its compact design, it can be easily stored in tight spaces or transported to any location.  I can't believe such a little device can produce such incredible sound!
This Echo is a huge upgrade from my previous one. The speaker is very clear...great for listening to my books on Audible while I do chores. It was easy to connect and set up.
Needed an alarm clock and decided on this echo. Not quite sure on using all the features like the sunrise function. Like that the light doesn’t keep the whole room lit at night.
The sound is better than the 4th generation but they use dots instead of dashes for showing the time; the look isn’t as smooth and as easy to read as the dashes.

reviewTitle: Ir replaced a much bigger clock radio in my bedroom and had better sound all for a good price
reviewDescription: So far I've used it mainly as a clock radio and alarm clock in my bedroom. I have to learn what other functions it can serve, like today's local weather forecast.

reviewTitle: Works as advertised but routines are too limiting
reviewDescription: Would be nice if I could make a routine that would notify me if Ring contact sensor was open more than configured amount of time.  Nope. Programmability is too limited.

reviewTitle: Husband hates it I LOVE IT!
reviewDescription: I got this for my son for alarm, music, timers, information…my husband was worried it would be abused…You can decide how to manage the Echo, add restrictions, then you can add more options as your child ages!

reviewTitle: Works well, wished #'s were slightly larger though
reviewDescription: I'm pretty pleased with my echo dot clock! I like most of everything about it except I wish the #'s were slightly larger. I don't have the BEST vision in my old age, while I can see the #'s fairly quickly & clearly, I believe that I would be better to focus on the #'s & time if they were slightly larger, or somehow either brighter, clearer, bigger pixels? or perhaps not dotted as they are? Perhaps I am missing a setting on the echo to eliminate the dotted pixeled #'s? Still very happy with the deep, base sound for such a small bedside, nightstand device, maybe next generations of the echo clock will add a brighter, larger "light" atmosphere function to add more light to the device instead of needing a lamp on my beside nightstand. Just a "hope" for future versions. Thanks

reviewTitle: Wonderful product but night dimmer not bright enough
reviewDescription: see above
excellent just as in the picture
Good

reviewTitle: Awesome, but needs to have the temp routines revised
reviewDescription: Love this echo dot! With one exception. I was excited to find that it can tell the ambient temperature and that can be used to set routines. I had plans to set up a routine to turn on my air conditioner (via a smart plug) in my bedroom if the temperature registered above 80 degrees after 8pm, so that my bedroom would be cooled automatically before bedtime if I'm not home to turn it on. Woohoo! Nope.... apparently, the temperature has to rise through the specified threshold after the specified time for this routine to work. So if my bedroom is already 80 degrees or hotter at 8pm, it does nothing. I really hope the Amazon tech team fixes this issue soon!
I love her.
Easy to use

reviewTitle: Worked well, until that persistent yellow light
reviewDescription: Lovely, sound quality fine, working well. Two days ago I have a solid yellow light ring. Hmm, asked Alexa who had no idea. Light doesn't blink like I have messages or notifications. Tried the App, unplugging for a few hours, and total reset. Nope. Light still there. It's really annoying, won't go away, lights up the whole room it's in, and no (to repeat) - it doesn't blink and it's yellow (not orange as when resetting). An older one I have, a hockey puck style with clock, is no longer made. Not happy with this. Okay, should have known: it's 4 hrs since full reset, had a actual blinking light for Notification and wouldn't you know it, once I listened to it the yellow light went out! (Got a 4th star for that guys!) Feel better and the duct tape is put away - for now.

reviewTitle: Please fix bug so that NPR can be shut off like anything else
reviewDescription: Most of the time, once this echo device begins playing NPR, which I like to use for news and as background noise for my pets while I'm away, you cannot get it to shut off again. "Alexa, stop," "Alexa, end playback," etc. results only in the echo lighting up to listen, but not turning off NPR. I have contacted customer support, but they don't seem to regard this as a known issue, merely user error. I even tried building s routine so Alexa would shut off NPR when I say "Alexa, I'm home," but that workaround failed as well. I very often have to resort to unplugging the device. Very frustrating, especially since there are reddit posts for years now complaining about this particular issue with NPR. Amazon's Alexa/Echo team should have fixed this known problem by now.Otherwise, as creepy as AI can be, it's been super convenient to have Alexa around, especially once I added a few smart bulbs and plugs.

Received both Echo Dot and Sengled Smart Light Bulb for $32 fantastic deal. The echo dot(5 Gen) has a great clock display in pairs fine with sync devices. I currently synced my blink mini camera to echo which alert me if movement is detected also alerts if Amazon package is dropped off at front door. Only issue I have a minor one at that is it only have 3 light colors blue, yellow and white just plain boring!

reviewTitle: Need to turn off red light on base of unit when muted!
reviewDescription: The overly bright red light on the base of the unit when on mute is horrendous. There needs to be a way to turn it off to make this a good product. I don't mind the red light at the top of the device. Bought this to try as an alarm clock on my nightstand and need to keep it on mute. The light is just way too much. I would also light to dim the intensity of the clock display.As is, this cannot be recommended for use in a bedroom where darkness is desired. I see there are rings that can be purchased to block the light. Not a very good solution when it should be a devise option.

reviewTitle: Don’t buy if you need a decent clock
reviewDescription: We have an older version (on the right) and I bought this one thinking it’s an improved version planning to keep in our bedroom and moving older one to the guest room. Well, this is a great example how it’s possible to ruin a decent product. Clock is barely visible on the new one and this is on the highest brightness setting. Really Amazon??!! I just set it up so have no idea if we’ll be also dealing with connectivity issues. The new one will be going into guest room and we’ll keep using the old one. If I didn’t get it on sale I would have returned it. What a disappointment.

reviewTitle: Kept disconnecting, did troubleshooting, still disconnects
reviewDescription: New unit. Kept disconnecting. When I went to return it, Amazon suggested troubleshooting. Did that over time and sometimes it behaved and sometimes not, still disconnecting. Finally did a factory reset which worked for a while. Yesterday it failed again. Now, it seems the option to return it isn't available. It say's it's "replaceable" unti 2024, but, there is no obvious mechanism or link to do so. Total fail.
Ordered November 2023.  Feb 5 2024:  heard a weird noise while listening to Audible and then smelled something burning.  Now I have to figure out how to get a replacement.

reviewTitle: Good luck listening to music if you don’t buy Amazon music.
reviewDescription: I actually like this product but I bought this so I can listen to Spotify and one for my son so he can listen to his pandora but linking them is so frustrating and doesn’t work will. It seems like If you aren’t willing to pay for Amazon music you’re going to have a difficult time using this product to listen to music from different apps.

Was excited to replace my old speaker. When set at a comfortable volume for its voice you can’t hear music or your show unless you crank it up to 9 at which time its voice is shouting. It just will not modulate its volume. Trash product so far.
I bought this alexa to my father just work for 6 months and that's it. I trying and trying to reconnect  but nothing happens,  I need some answers about that.

The Echo performed as expected for most functions.  However I was unable to create a stereo pair with another 5th generation Echo I purchased that didn't have a clock.  After 45 minutes on the phone with Amazon tech support we concluded the item should be replaced. I received the replacement Echo with clock this week and it was also unable to pair with my existing Echo without clock. Ironically the Echo without clock easily paired with a second generation Echo I had from several years ago!I've concluded that there is some bug with the 5th generation Echo with clock that prevents it from creating a stereo pair.

reviewTitle: Don't buy this dot if you need an assisted!
reviewDescription: The Amazon Echo Dots look and sound great, and the visual display is a nice touch. However, we’ve had some issues with the listening ability of all of them this eco is the worst. mostly they hear commands, but often they don’t. They’re supposed to be able to detect occupancy, which was a big part of why we upgraded. Unfortunately, I have to say at least 3 times so they can be made something. I don't know  what this dot has with music I just said "Alexa tell me the weather" and they put music always they put music Im tired of saying "Alexa stop the music"
The set up was very difficult and not easy to understand at all and I’ve had it over a month still not set up. Using it for alarm clock and music

reviewTitle: Very Hard to See the Time in Living Room
reviewDescription: We ordered an Echo Dot globe in Deep Sea Blue several months ago and I regretted that I had not ordered one with the clock on it. When prime days rolled around, I ordered another globe with the time display. Only light blue and white colors were offered And we chose the light blue. We are very disappointed because it is so difficult to see the time even when we have it on the highest setting of 10 brightness. The numbers are small and difficult to see. At first, we thought it was the brightness, but even when we turned it up to 10, it was still very dim. The clock is in our living room and we sit about 9-10 ft from it in the evening in a relatively dim room. Maybe the time would’ve shown up better if it was on the deep sea blue color which is close to navy. . It seems it is made only for an alarm clock. It may work very nice on a nightstand right next to your bed, which would make the time very easy to see. After reading other reviews, it seems that this particular echo brightens its self during the day and dims itself at night, no matter what brightness setting you have it on. We are sending it back because we have enough echo dots around and only wanted this one because of the clock. But obviously, if we can’t see it very well, it is not serving its purpose for us.
Mas o menos

reviewTitle: Improved over Gen 4 but still has lots of room for improvement
reviewDescription: This Echo Dot (5th Generation) has improved sound quality but is still lacking. I don't expect world-class sound from a little speaker at this price but Amazon could certainly add the ability to customize various settings beyond what's available now.There is only 1 simple 3-band equalizer that applies to the entire system. They could make it a 5-band or 7-band EQ.  They could also let you set at least 2 different EQ settings, one for the voice and one for everything else.I find that the speaker has a general overall colored sound that's hard to get around with a simple 3-band EQ, and if you have a moderate hearing loss, the Alexa voice will still sound somewhat muffled at lower volumes.The addition of more displayed information is welcome but it would be great if this were customizable as well and open to 3rd party data.

reviewTitle: This is not the echo to buy if you really want a good experience with Alexa
reviewDescription: I bought this to downsize and replace an Echo Show.  I liked the fact it had the time on it.  However, I am hard of hearing.  I turn the device to level 7 volume.  I have tried everything I know to make it stay there but it turns itself down to where I cannot hear alarms that I set, reminders I set or other uses I have for the device.  I am constantly having to tell the Echo to turn the volume up to 7.  I have told it to leave it there permanently, to never change it, to stop adjusting volume levels.  Nothing works.  I never had this problem with any other echo device, so this device is not broken but it has bugs in its design.  I would not ever buy it again.

reviewTitle: Using as a clock radio replacement
reviewDescription: Works well as a clock radio replacement, but without a battery backup for any power outage. The automatic dimming of the clock led makes the clock too dim. The iPhone app is terrible, and only useful to set up the Echo Dot and enter routines.

The clock is made of dots and the resolution is just a little rough to be clear sometimes.  It'd be helpful if they made the numbers bigger.  I have not been able to find a setting that allows it to dim appropriately at night but still be easy to see during the day.  I don't think it's possible to configure your own preferences for auto dimming but I could be wrong. I just haven't found anything that works.  The voice recognition doesn't seem to be any better than devices that are a couple generations older - also a disappointment because anybody who has these knows how often they mess up.  In short, I see no reason to get a new one if you already had one, and I wouldn't get it just for the clock.

reviewTitle: privacy right out the window, with ads
reviewDescription: ill start with the good, the speaker sounds good, it answers questions i asked, but at what cost?i was using google for a long time and wanted to see what amazon was about since i enjoy there prime services. heres what i found,i logged it for 30 days and my server blocked 34,786 trackers.... IN ONE MONTH, thats over 1100 per day, what do you possibly need to know to that extent?! ive ran this same test on all the smart speaker brands and this is by FAR the worstthe echo show was good, then it over time became plastered with ads, i paid extra for a display to use, not for you to shove ads on it.to me, this device is a privacy concern above others and went back. after my testing ive decided echo is not for me, if this isnt a concern to you, it was a good device, and if the above wasnt true id have kept it. the clock was a nice addition

reviewTitle: Unfortunately, Could Not Get Past The Display
reviewDescription: I have two 4th Generation Echo Dots with Clock Display, and I absolutely LOVE them!  I was excited to order the 5th generation...but my excitement quickly turned to frustration with the clock display.First, the display is too blocky.  Every number or letter is composed of large dots leading to squared corners. Although it is a bigger display, I think it is harder to read and not very attractive.  The previous version has rounded corners and is much easier to read.The worst issue for me is the brightness of the display.  The Echo Dot does not auto-adjust the brightness like my other two 4th generation Echo Dots.  I could turn on the room light, and the clock would get brighter to make it more visible.  Also, when I turned off the room light, the clock display would dim to a very appropriate level.  The 5th generation Echo Dot does not do this.  I have tried adjusting the brightness level so the Echo Dot can "learn" my preference, but the feature is a failure.  I have to manually go into the app to adjust the display at night because it brightens up the room regardless of the light adjusting around it.  I never had to use the app to adjust the display on my other two Dots.I have not tried the other new features with this 5th generation version.  I am sure they are great, but I will be returning this item.  Hopefully, the next Echo Dot release will fix the clock display.

reviewTitle: Very clean design and nice LED and a couple of nice features, but horrible responses.
reviewDescription: I got this Amazon Alexa Echo with clock after switching from a Google Nest Mini 2.Here are some positives and negatives:Positives:- Almost instant reply and response (Google Nest had a very slow response)- The clock feature- It can tell you your room temperature- You can whisper and it’ll whisper back which is especially useful during the nighttime.- You can change its wake phrase.- It has many different and unique “skills” available.- It has very nice LED lights on the bottom.Negatives:- Although it has almost instant response, it’s responses are not very helpful or accurate when compared to a Google assistant.- Sometimes it just completely ignores what you’re saying even when it activates, and other times when you tell it to turn on the light or turn it off or turn on a switch, it doesn’t work the first time and you have to try a second time.- The Alexa app on your phone is absolutely atrocious! This app is extremely buggy and it’s an absolute mess to find certain settings or features and very cluttered! The google home app on the other hand, had a very clean UI and interface and was easy to use and find settings.The reason I rated this a 3/5, is because although it has a lot of very nice features, if it doesn’t do the most important things properly, it gets very frustrating and makes the other features somewhat overlooked.Overall, I’d still prefer a google nest mini over this, but if the negatives are fixed or improved, then I’d definitely recommend the Alexa.

reviewTitle: Downgrade in sound quality. Stick with the previous generation.
reviewDescription: I wanted to replace the previous generation dot in my master bathroom with one that has a clock. Trade-in program made that a reasonable option. Coincidentally, the day that I looked on Amazon is the day they released this new generation for pre-order.Form factor is almost identical to the previous. Features are good. Display is now a dot matrix, which is definitely more flexible in terms of what it can display. But two things keep me from recommending this speaker:1) Poor sound quality versus the previous dot (in the same exact location and environment as my old one). Fine for podcasts, but music sounds like the bit rate is heavily compressed. Highs are harsh and uneven, and they don't extend much. Mids are messy. Bass is decent enough for the size of the speaker, comparable to the last one. One of the biggest grievances is the compression (not only of bit rate, but also of tone and volume). Even with the EQ set totally flat and at low/moderate volume, you can hear the speaker constantly adjusting to prevent overdriving the little speaker. I've dialed the bass on mine almost all the way down and it still has a boomy and compressy sound to it. Ultimately, it just sounds like a cheap speaker subject to way too much processing to make it sound almost adequate to most casual listeners. My old one sounded WAY cleaner.. Even enjoyable. I previously never felt compelled to bring another speaker into my bathroom, but now I want to. But....2) They got rid of the 3.5mm output. Now your only option for improving the mediocre sound quality is to pair to a Bluetooth speaker, which, in my experience, is wonky at best. If your device shows up at all (my Klipsch One II from my kitchen does not), you'll likely run into the issue of the speaker automatically shutting down after not receiving a signal for a while.So ultimately, I regret this purchase. Stick with the previous generation. If you can utilize the trade program more than once, I'll likely trade this one for the old one, despite still having a couple 1st and 2nd generation devices. This is the one that disappoints.

The Echo Dot version 5 has a serious problem integrating with the Ring camera system.  When linking the doorbell and/or stick up Ring cameras to Alexa the audible Ring notifications go to the Echo Dot and not to your IPhone.  This means that when you are away from home your Echo Dot will be announcing the notifications to an empty room while your IPhone is silent.  There is no provision in the Alexa software to send verbal notifications to both your IPhone and to the Echo Dot.  The only way to work around this is to unclick the notifications to the Echo Dot in the Alexa software. That way you continue to get verbal notifications on your IPhone but not on the Echo Dot.  This seems like a software problem that could be easily solved but it has not.  I contacted Amazon support and they confirmed that there is no fix except to turn off notifications from to the Echo Dot for each camera.  Otherwise the device seems to be working properly.Update:  I tried to continue using the Echo Dot with the Ring alarm system bypassing the cameras.  The Echo Dot makes itself part of the Ring alarm system by listening for loud noises and then sounding a separate alarm on the Echo Dot if it hears something. The Echo Dot is in my bedroom.  My Ring alarm system is in an adjacent guest house.  When I arm the Ring alarm system for "Away" the Echo Dot makes itself part of that system and alarms whenever I move around in the main house.  The only way to fix this problem, according to Ring and Alexa, is to disable the Ring alarm in the Echo Dot.  This defeats the purpose of using the Echo Dot to communicate with the Ring system so I am sending the Echo Dot back.

Maybe my Alexa is just lazy and is like a kid and says it's going to do something that it doesn't do or maybe mine is just a liar I would be embarrassed if I put something out that worked like this.
