reviewTitle: that they charge a fee for this
reviewDescription: I never saw where they charge a monthly fee for this, Had I been made aware of the fee I would never have bought it, for all accounts this is a deceptive trade practice and should be known before your purchase.

reviewTitle: Ugh..I am back to my original Echo
reviewDescription: I have used an an Echo or Dot as my bedside "clock radio" ever since these devices came out.  This one with the clock seemed perfect.  Not.First,, the clock.  It is very bright.  I was able to dim it using the app but it won't  stay dimmed from day to day.  I finally had to turn the "clock face" off because Echo seems to recognize either full bright or off only.Second: connectivity.  It skips or fades out all the time.  When I am using it as a "radio" or having it read Audible books or even using sleep sounds the sound is spotty or inconsistent.  My other devices that rely on wi-fi coverage don't  have this issue; my Amazon fire TV in the same room doesn't  have this problem.  I had this problem with my previous spherical Dot as well.  I don't  have this issue with my original Echo which I've now moved back to my nightstand.  Sound quality doesn't  matter all that much if the connectivity is so bad.

reviewTitle: Awful voice recognition after all these years
reviewDescription: I have two of these almost 30 feet apart from each other, in different rooms. Almost always, the wrong one responds - every morning I lean over to the device a foot from my head and say “Alexa, snooze” and the one in the living room responds. Frequently doesn’t respond at all or misunderstands. It’s amazing that after all these years Amazon is still so deeply incapable of making a good device.

I went back to my echo Dot. This fifth generation is so slow to respond. I have to repeat over and over again for it to follow a command with the Smart Switch. I plugged in my old Echo Dot and compare the two in response time, turning on and off lights, fans, smart plugs. My old Echo dot wins out every time. This is fifth generation needs some tweaks.

I bought this over a year ago and it was working great up until a few days ago. It seems to like to talk back with a massive attitude when we ask it to do something or it tells us it can't do that. It won't even work with our wake word now. No response whatsoever unless we push a button on top of it. I have looked all over the internet, on Amazon, in the Amazon app, unplugged it, reset the internet, and checked all the settings, even made sure that the do not disturb is not on but have not found a solution. Rather disappointed with this product. We have some of the older generations from 2019 that work better and have had no problems with them.

Like the dot and clock. This is our 4th Echo dot we have but the others are Gen 3 and 4. For some reason Gen 5 is not supported in a Smart Home Group with 1-4. It says it right in the app. Why have a new Gen that I cannot link with the rest of my speakers to get music playing all around our home. Poor!!!

reviewTitle: I might as well speak another language
reviewDescription: Hate it.  This model doesn't understand well.  My other echo Dot works fine.  This one, I might as well be speaking a foreign language.  Not even close, does it get commands.  I've restarted, reprogrammed and nothing.  If I didn't throw away the box thinking it would be as great as the first one, I'd return it.  What a rip off!

There is something seriously wrong with our Echo Alarm Clock. Most of the time, it never respond to any commands... even to snooze. At least half the time we have to reboot it before we can make it redone to command. We have tons of other Echo devices, so it isn't user error. But this one Echo device is just faulty.

We always had a 2nd gen, and we figured it was time to expand and got this 5th gen. We were excited about the larger speaker. However this doesn’t answer as well and seems to have problems understanding and hearing. It also turns off sleep sounds on loop after a few minutes. All of these issues were never present in the 2nd gen.

Sound is muffled. The LCD display is hard to read from the distance. And it is too bright to have it on night stand even though the brightness is set to Zero still it disturbs me every time I turn to that side of my bed. It has an option to turn off lcd display but then u don’t know what time is it when u wake up in the middle of the night.Overall, I would not recommend it.Also the volume is weird it’s either too low or its too loud. It seems like u can never get the volume to be perfect especially when listening to an audio books.

reviewTitle: less than a year and the speaker failed
reviewDescription: Guess they figure out these don't last and that is why they only have a 90 day warranty ,, If I could find the replacement speaker I would fix it

reviewTitle: Worked pretty good until it died.
reviewDescription: Worked fine until it just died. Before it died for several weeks odd things would happen like always disconnecting from internet, nothing else had this problem, loosing connections with smart lights, my other echo dot had no problems with this. Often had to reset the device as much as 5 times a day or disconnect the wifi again and again with devices only feet away in same room. Again this only happened with this device, never had an problems with the other echo dot. Now its dead, never dropped, plunged in water, thrown against a wall, crushed by a train etc...Its just dead for no reason.

reviewTitle: "I’m having trouble hearing. Can you say that again?"
reviewDescription: That's what I get about half the time with this device, "I’m having trouble hearing. Can you say that again?"  None of the other 11 Echo devices in my household have this problem, just the one Echo Dot with Clock.I wish they made a regular Echo with a clock display.

reviewTitle: When it works, it's great. But requires constant resetting
reviewDescription: I've had this for just over a year, and in the past few weeks it's been unresponsive at night- I have to unplug it and plug it back in.  Interestingly, the clock continues to work and the alarm will continue to work- but the device will not respond. Which means if the alarm is going off, you have to unplug the device to get it to stop.  It's super annoying. I haven't changed anything so I'm not sure why it's doing this.

Has never worked properly. Ask it to play a song and it will say ok here's the song and then not play anything. Usually have to say Alexa 2 or three times before it responds. When playing a podcast it will play about 5 minutes and then stop. When you try to get it to explain what the problem is it just says go to the Alexa app which is of absoulutey no help. I regret buying this piece of junk.
How is this glacier white? This is grey. Should be named dirty glacier white.

reviewTitle: WARNING!!! Limited compatibility with Bluetooth hearingbdevices
reviewDescription: I have a cochlear implant it works with my iPhone to project sound from my iPhone to my cochlear audio output device.  Not so with echo dot!!!  At least echo dot support not able to help. I’m afraid this product definitely not for hearin impaired

I have 3 of these in my house and 2 of them just stop listening all the time. We set alarms daily and really that is the main thing we use them for and it either won’t set the alarm or won’t turn off. You literally have to unplug it constantly to reset it. It is not an internet issue because I was just in the other room setting another kid’s alarm. UGH! Am sooooo frustrated

My old Amazon dots all let me connect both my Amazon music and Apple Music accounts, which was a big factor in deciding to purchase this product. After receiving it and programming it, I learned that it no longer has Apple Music capabilities. It works wonderfully and I love the clock, so I’m willing to sacrifice not having Apple Music, but I wouldn’t have purchased had Amazon made it clear it was no longer compatible

reviewTitle: not good clock for the bedroom
reviewDescription: Even thou this product works very well the problem is with the light below it-  It disrupts my sleep-  Why is that light needed?  The light is too bright for a bedroom alarm clock

reviewTitle: Amazon's Recent Downgrade of Their Own Service
reviewDescription: Amazon has recently released a new feature for their Amazon Echo; when you ask it to play a particular song, it will play that song and other music "like it."  If you ask it to play a particular album or to play music from a particular artist, it won't do it; it will play one song from that album or that artist and will then begin playing music "like it."  And Amazon is claiming that this is an "improvement."Even if you own the music - you paid Amazon to have access to those particular songs - it won't just play the music you own; it will play music "like it."  Even if you've made playlists of your own, whether it is a playlist of songs you've paid for or not, it will not play music from the playlist; it will play music "like it."As I understand it, this is a feature that was released in November.  Initially, their customer service representatives referred to it as being a bug.  They eventually had to acknowledge that this was a new feature, and that the only way to disable it is to pay a subscription for "upgraded" service.  So now you have to pay to have the same features you used to have.

I’ve had Alexa/echo devises since the beginning. The newer releases don’t seem to be as reliable. It’s disappointing. I probably won’t be ordering anymore until they can keep them from giving false notifications, listening (light spinning) when not asked and not understanding when I do ask it to tell me something. If I repeat the question she gets it, but has to be asked more than once.

The blue Echo Dot with the clock display is very nice.The sound is great, the display is clear through the speaker grill, also displaying volume, temperature, headlines — whatever you ask for. In all, a sweet little speaker.But this particular device will not play Audible books reliably.It gets started, than announces “I am having trouble playing this title” and thenceforth does not respond to any command. The book still plays, but I can’t stop, pause, change volume, or give any command to Alexa; the Dot is simply locked up.  The only cure is to cycle power.I tried going to Amazon forums, searching the web generally, resetting the device — nothing works.I need to listen to audiobooks with this device. So, sorry — I am sending it back.
Me agrada la calidad del sonido.Me agrada el diseño.Me desagrada que este dispositivo no se sincroniza bien.Me desagrada que el reconocimiento de voz ante los comandos no es muy eficiente.

Everything was fine until it stopped connecting to the internet. now it tells me my wifi password is wrong, but my other alexa has no issue connecting. I tried unplugging and resetting it but now I can't even get it into setup mode. It just sits with a solid blue light. My alexa app doesn't even recognize it anymore either. Pretty disappointing.
Difficult to use. Wont accept voice commands directly. Must use my phone. Time face is dull. Hard to read at night. Instructions are sketchy. BUT the sound quality for radio is excellent.

I wear glasses, so at night when I take them off for bed, cannot see numbers, if I bring it closer to me, then the light is too bright from the clock, you can only dim them so much, I ended up turning off the display, so now it is just an echo dot, pretty useless as a clock....

I just ordered my second echo dot with the clock because I love them so much! I just received it today and while trying to set it up the power cord would not work🤦🏼 they don’t make just the replacement cords so now I have to completely re order a new one ugh…
I have to reset it several times a day. Very disappointing! Sometimes it just shuts down when ever. Wish I hadn’t bought it.

reviewTitle: For being a speaker does not sound that good
reviewDescription: Connected to phone for Bluetooth and crap sound. So now it's just a clock. I thought amazon made better quality than that.

reviewTitle: Expensive. Have to replace in less than 1 year.
reviewDescription: A few weeks my dot stop responding to voice commands. Had to unplug and sometimes factory reset to get it to work. Today it started to make a noise and would not reset. I have to buy another in less than one year.

reviewTitle: this one has a mind of it's owne
reviewDescription: this echo dot just wants to do what it wants to do and not take orders all the time . we tell it to put it's volume to 6 and then it returns to 4 when you need a reply from it.

I was well pleased the first 2 weeks after I I programed it,then when I asked if to play music or questions or alarms it mixed them up with one another,I just went back to using my old alarm clock music device

Information is usually incorrect if asked a question seems to use old information from unreliable sources one of the reasons I purchased echo was to be able to get information about mountain pass road closures and other questions answered hands free

reviewTitle: Eero built in..... don't belive it.
reviewDescription: Have this connected to my Eero router.  The echo dot is supposed to have eero built in to function as an extender.  This hasn't worked since I received it.  Always says out of range for eero built in.  The dot is only about 25 feet from the router!!  Worthless.  The clock is nice and the sound is better than my old dot.  Thank goodness I only paid $25 for it, however the eero extender was one of the reasons I got it in the first place!

reviewTitle: Has to be plugged in to use
reviewDescription: It’s disappointing because the photos make it as though it doesn’t have to constantly be plugged in to use but I’ve come to find out that it does. Not convenient like the photos show.

this was my first time purchasing an an alexa and i have to say i’m deeply disappointed. i have tried to trouble shoot so that it could connect to my wifi. i’ve plugged and unplugged it multiple times and i plugged it directly next to my wifi router and it still won’t connect. my sister and i even disconnected our phones from the wi-fi and it still won’t work. every other device in my house seems to be connected just fine to the wifi router so that’s the reason i haven’t restarted it and to be frank it would just be a hassle. this experience has been a deeply unpleasant and disappointing experience for me and i advice people who plan to purchase this product to please think twice.
Had the last gen and got this one. Big step backwards. impossible to see at night from 8 ft away.  LED's are ridiculously bad. Very disappointed.

Doesn't connect to wifi out of the box?? Looked up this issue and it happens alot apparently (small indie company btw) now I have to go thru the hassle of returning it and buying something else L product don't buy unless you want your time and money waisted

reviewTitle: If it stayed connected to the internet, it might not be so bad, going back to Google
reviewDescription: Wow, love I can ask to play my music playlists, it would be nice if I could though.  Wow, stream a movie on my TV, work all day, no problems.  Stream music, ask for the weather.. "sorry, I can't connect to the internet right now" or.. just hear 14 seconds of a song, wait 5 minutes, then it plays again, for, 16 more seconds.  Shame.

I bought the 5th generation Echo Dot Clock after my 4th generation Echo Dot clock started randomly going unresponsive and spinning the blue ring for hours/days at a time.Unfortunately, the new version has its own problems, where it'll play the first thirty seconds of a song and then simply stop. It doesn't seem aware of its own failing, and if you ask it why it stopped it'll say it has no idea what you're asking.The quality of the Echo devices' software seems to have declined dramatically in the last year. Perhaps cost-cutting, as Amazon realized this division was losing billions of dollars per year? :(

reviewTitle: Just like 1st gen, will not connect
reviewDescription: I don't know why I thought a new one would work any better than the 1st gen, but it just will not connect to the wifi. I've tried everything. Too much of a headache, it's just not worth it.

reviewTitle: If you’re using this with Spotify, avoid!
reviewDescription: Had a 3rd gen echo dot and wanted to add an additional speaker. I use the echo as a timer, to play Spotify, and for weather. The addition of the new 5th gen echo dot has ruined the entire system. Not only does the new device not show up as an option to play, the old device is now “restricted” and unusable. Search this issue and you’ll find it’s not new - it’s been going on since 2020 with no solution. Whatever the issue is - Amazon not resolving because it’s Spotify and not their product, or Spotify not resolving because it’s Amazon, it’s beyond frustrating that users are caught in the middle. I have restarted, re-paired, uninstalled and reinstalled, allowed explicit content (as per the recommendations on the Internet) and I’m done. I will be returning and attempting to get the old speaker to work.

Thought we would upgrade our old Dot to a newer one with a clock. Big mistake!!!! This one will play a few minutes then pause. I looked at the trouble shooting and it said it could be a poor Internet connection. But the old one doesn't have a problem. I did disconnect everything from the Internet and it continues to pause. Returning 😔

UPDATE: My Echo Dot continues to be defective. An Amazon representative suggested trying a new power cord. The device is still shorting out and is not working. The website says eligible for return through December 15, 2023. I expect my device to be replaced at this point.The Echo Dot I just purchased 6 months ago completely stopped working. I went through every trouble shooting strategy possible. The device simply won’t respond at all to anything. Amazon will no longer accept a return and only offered trouble shooting options with no follow through. This is not acceptable for a device only 6 months old.

I use 3 Eco Dots for my stereo systems so it plays music through my killer speakers. I'm returning the new 5th generation one I bought. Guess I won't have the clock and just use the older style. Disappointing.

When I first got it I absolutely loved it, worked for t weeks then started skipping, would not turn off unless I unplugged it, stayed in repeat mode for reminders would not shut down. Couldn't listen to my favorite stations without unplugging device. I was very disappointed. Returned device waiting for  replacement.

I’d like to have fewer devices overall, and I thought this would replace a clock and older dot.  In theory, it should, but the adaptive brightness is an abject failure.  I gave it a few days, tried adjusting the brightness at night (dimmer) and in the morning (brighter) to see if it would learn my preferences.  It does not.  At the brightness I need for daytime, it’s much too bright for sleep.  The dimness needed for night makes it invisible in the day.  Alas, it could be great, but it does not work for me.

I've had about three or four of these things, never had any problem with them. This one doesn't even know where it is and I can't seem to fix it! I have to tell it where it is so they can get me the weather. Help! I want to say something positive it does sound good.

I think they might have dumbed down this speaker, because it can't seem to do anything consistently. Doesn't have a lot of features. I can only use it for music, alarms, notifications, shopping list, and that's about it. voice control of the tv doesn't work half the time even though it says it recognizes it.

Motion detection is useless for starters, temp sensor reads about 7 degrees cooler than actual temp, and theres no way to calibrate.  Whatever theyve done with the new microphones... they WORK! It will hear you through walls, across the house so take that for what its worth, but shes listing. Clock feature is nice

Display is hard to read and distracting when the song titles constantly scroll across the screen and no way to stop it. The dots are too big and hard to read at night. Audio quality is good but they should have used the display on the 4th gen units. Wish I could find a 4th generation one with premium sound and clock. Old display was so much better.

reviewTitle: Not as good as the original old Echo Dot
reviewDescription: I do like the sound of this as far as music goes, however, my old original echo dot was more responsive than this one. We are constantly having to repeat ourselves to the point that my husband yells at this thing 🤣 "She" is always repeating herself even though we answer her during quizzes. Sometimes she just starts talking about something when we are having a conversation nearby. My husband always tells me to "just unplug the damn thing" 😵‍💫Maybe I just got a bad one. I don't know, but wish I never bought this

It just stops playing music and then restarts few minutes later. Sometimes it stops permanently. It may have been on for a very short time and just turns off. It also can rarely answer a question. Alexa is kinda stupid.
I absolutely loathe this thing. It never responds to prompts, fails to detect devices, and generally sucks. The echo pop works perfectly. What gives?

reviewTitle: This thing does what it is supposed to most of the time, but frequently glitches.
reviewDescription: Bought this as a gift for one of my adult children, but he decided he didn’t want it. We kept it to use. It’s just ok-glitches out fairly frequently. Voice recognition is not too great-apparently it will answer to anyone in my household, not just me and my husband. I don’t find it all that useful, but we decided not to return it.
Love the clear voice.  Really love the clock especially at night, it has a soft glow. The dot is a good alarm  clock too!
This is my first Echo. I liked it so much I bought one more. Added outlet plug and lite bulb. No problems. Install was easy.
I have roughly 12 Echo devices all throughout my home and I love them!!! I use this one as an alarm clock and it works flawlessly. You won't be disappointed!
I’ve been without an Alexa for almost 2 years… I’m so happy to have this back again, and the sound quality playing music is fantastic.

Our house hold has plenty of smart devices. I am so happy with this new echo dot with the alarm clock feature. It’s super convenient to have the time showing on the device. I enjoy having it on the night stand and be able to control or ask other devices to turn on or off.I highly recommend if you have smart devices with Alexa to upgrade your alarm clock with this echo dot.

reviewTitle: I Was Worried About the Clock Light
reviewDescription: I bought this product to replace my alarm clock.  When I read a review of the Echo Dot with Clock in the Wirecutter, I was a little worried that the light from the clock would be too bright and keep me awake at night.  Good news:  the clock light is not in the least bit obtrusive.  Everything about this product has been smooth from the get go.  Alexa can play my Apple Music or my Sirius XM radio.  She is a quick learner and setting her up was a breeze.  I don’t think I’ll ever get another clock radio.
Still can not connect my Amazon music, but it’s alright; I love my little box that odd packed with a huge punch. My grandson loves to ask her math questions.

reviewTitle: Great Gift for a Non-Tech Savvy Senior
reviewDescription: This was a Christmas gift for my 88 year old Aunt. My initial concerns about her using it quickly vanished once I set it up for her. She jumped right in and is listening to the music she loves from the 30’s and 40’s. She’s already obtained phone numbers and other information that was difficult for her to get as she does not have a PC or Tablet.

reviewTitle: I love having Alexa at my fingertips.
reviewDescription: I love that she has the time displayed where I can view it easily. I love that she sets a timer when I'm cooking or gives me the outside temperature.
Cute and sleek. Amazing quality clock and Alexa. The clock light self dims when I turn off the lights in the room. Better than expected.

Put off getting this since I had an alarm clock and figured that was good enough. Wrong. This is a really useful gadget. I use it to wake me, get myself out of bed, and get the day (and me) going (by playing rousing marching music). Also, I time my exercises and get the weather and stock prices with it. It really has been a boon. Now I can't live without it (well, I could I suppose, but I wouldn't want to).

Initially I was annoyed with my purchase as I wanted to pair it with my desktop computer however there was not an iTunes web app for it and I already have sooo many apps on my phone. Once I gave in and installed the app on my phone, I fell in love with it! So many things it can be used for - it reminds me to take my evening medicine, tells me the water in the morning, etc. I have not yet moved into the "smart home" arena yet as I don't want to buy new appliances but I really appreciate the applications it has for daily life.

I love the clock on the Alexa! I used to wake up in the middle of the night and have to ask Alexa what time it is! Now I just roll over and look! I really lole the shape of this echo too it looks nice in a room!

I got this as a gift and was worried I would need a subscription or have Amazon Prime to be able to use it but all you’ll need is the Alexa app. I specifically was asking for a Bluetooth speaker and an alarm clock that I can dim the display on so it’s not so bright while I’m trying to sleep. I got this and it’s like two in one. I will end up getting a separate Bluetooth speaker since this has to stay plugged into the wall but I can connect my Spotify through the app and it will play my music that way. You can turn the ring light off through the app (I think it’s the “do not disturb” feature) and still ask Alexa for whatever you need. Before, I was flipping my old alarm clock on its face to keep the light from bothering me but now I can ask Alexa the time, turn the display on and off, and ask for the weather all from my bed and without getting on my phone. Alexa is shockingly good at hearing what I’m asking for even if I’m not talking loud or on the other side of the room which is nice so I can keep the noise down so as to not bother my roommate. I’m so happy with this and will be recommending it to anyone.

reviewTitle: Fue un súper regalo que me hice.
reviewDescription: Me encanta. Suena súper chévere, es bonita y tiene muchas cosas simpáticas.Ojo, al software le falta mucho, y la aplicación, al menos para android es lenta y medio enredada, pero la verdad, que esos puntos malos, no le quitan nada de todo lo bueno que tiene.

reviewTitle: This is the best thing since sliced bread!
reviewDescription: So enjoyable I bought a second for upstairs bedroom.  I enjoy the  warm, rich, mellow tone and immediate response of Alexa to my request for music.  Everything about this device from its pleasing appearance and display is awesome and notifications from Amazon regarding orders and shipments is timely.  I also like the weather updates. Alexa is a very nice addition to my family. WAY TO GO AMAZON, YOU HIT ANOTHER GRANDE SLAM HOMER with this one!

The price is right.  I have an echo device in just about every room in my house.  I use this one to listen to music when I'm enjoying the day/evening on my patio.  I'll probably use it for a travel device.

Works as intended.  Tells me the weather and an occasional joke.  Clock feature makes asking the time unnecessary and cuts down on useless conversation.  It has a lot of other features I don’t use but maybe useful to others.

reviewTitle: Great companion and helpful in daily control of items and events
reviewDescription: Purchased this echo from my wife for a Valentine’s Day present gives her somebody to talk to when I’m not home we have used it for finding items on the fire TV. We have also used it for setting timer for cooking asking about whether and especially severe weather and it even sings to us, the cat didn’t know what to think about that at first, but even she’s getting used to it

reviewTitle: VERY IMPORTANT READ BEFORE YOU BUY
reviewDescription: If you have an android smart phone, the Alexa app will not run. I have a Samsung J7 which was not compatable witrh the APP. Noiw I already bought the Echo 5th Gen (3) and I am getting frustrated with the situation. The smartphone or android device HAS TO BE YOURS and has to be registered on AMAZON. So with no way to program these buggers I had a friend come over with his phone  which had the app and he got them programmed. Problem: tnhe 3 Eco Dots were registered to his AMAZON.  When I ashed ECHO where I was, it gave me the name opf his coty and not mine.So I had my buddy DEREGISTER the 3 echo dots and after speaking with support, I ordered a FIRE HD8 tablet, It came preloaded with the ALEXA app. So I got the battery charged and got connected to my wifi. From their I confirmed my Amazon credentials and I was able to pen the app and within 10 minutes, the echi dots were programmed.So if your sart phone is registered on Amazon, look up the Aexa app and if it lists your phone with red X on either side, you will have to buy the tabket,

I really like this echo dot. It is the perfect size for my bedside table, it does not have bright lights so it does not make it hard to sleep. But best of all it gives the bedroom temperature. Love it.

I now have several of the Echo/Dot units spread about the rooms. This one with the clock is nice for my husband to see what the time is. Having this unit has helped me in many ways. I can drop in to say reminders, be sure all is ok in another room. I use the shopping list and reminders. The sound quality is just fine for us, I found I can slow down the voice so I can better understand what it is saying. Plus it is just plain fun.

reviewTitle: A great clock for any room
reviewDescription: I bought this clock for a guest room and ended up using it myself.  I'm very happy with all the features - amount of light, ease of reading the clock, and integrating with the rest of my Alexa items.

reviewTitle: Better than my old clock radio
reviewDescription: This has replaced my old clock radio.  I can ask Alexa , what time is it?  And Alexa, set an alarm for 7 am with many choices for alarm sound and volume using the app on my phone.Also it plays nature sounds like rain or surf for free.If you can wait until Black Friday in November you will get a great price.

reviewTitle: How did I live without you, Alexa?
reviewDescription: I never thought I'd get a smart speaker but this one was so inexpensive and so I fell for it.  So easy to set up and use, and great sound in the bathroom where I keep it.  But I used it to control other speakers in the house too.  Really happy to have tried it and maybe will get another 1 or 2.

Ya know what, sometimes when you're alone it's nice to have someone to talk to, this covers that. Games, music, weather, time, jokes, it does so much. I use it with smart devices like my lights and works good.
We have 4 Alexa's in the house and we use them for everything! Music, alarms, reminders, We even use them as intercoms to each other instead of yelling up the stairs to kids 🤣 love these so much!!
Best feature is the clock but I love having an Alexa in two different rooms now and the fact that I bought smart bulbs and then they can both turn them on at different levels of the house

reviewTitle: Great sound for the size, love the clock feature
reviewDescription: I gave this as a gift, they love it. Especially the size and sound quality. She put it in the kitchen so she can listen to NPR in the mornings when making her all-important coffee. I like the clock feature, and easy to use manual controls on top of the unit. Sound quality for music is better than my older Echo units.

I was originally hesitant to get a Dot in my home and decided to start out with a Gen 3 for my living room. Only after a month, I ordered a second one for my bedroom.After using those for about 3 years, I decided to upgrade to the Gen 5 and once again, haven't regretted having them.At times, as with my old dots, I have to repeat myself, but that may be due to placement, so I don't hold that against them.  My favorite part is the display. Being able to look over and see the time has let me remove multiple clocks from my home just for that reason. I also love that there is a feature to dim the display when the lights are out (especially in the bedroom when trying to go to sleep).Even though I've had these for 2 months, I just seen that some questions are also answered with text on the display, such as weather, measurement conversions, most math equations, spellings of words, and even what music is being played.If you want to get an Echo Dot or upgrade the one(s) you currently have, I highly recommend this generation, just for the endless options. And the round/ball design add a little art influence in my home that was pretty lacking from before.

EDIT: After submitting my review, I received a phone call from Amazon customer service. She asked if she could try to help with the problem. We spent an hour on the phone trying to get the issue cleared up, which didn't happen, but she was very nice and apologetic. It doesn't make sense that Alexa cannot play music from Amazon Prime, but reading the Amazon Forum, it looks like similar issues started a couple of years ago and was never completely solved.I liked my older Alexa, but started having connection problems so I thought I'd spring for a newer model. This replacement is an absolute dud. The sound quality is poor; the voice goes loud and soft in the same sentence. Ask a question-bright light, no answer. The clock does work, but that's about all it's good for. I'm really disappointed in Amazon all around now.

This product does not pair properly with the  iPhone. It will connect and disconnect randomly. It will suddenly connect and turn on at full volume. It makes weird beeping noises randomly. Even the clock doesn't really work properly! It will get stuck at a time for 2-3 minutes and then catch up to the proper time in a few seconds. How do you make a product with a clock that doesn't even work properly? That all said, the brightness of the clock is just fine. If only everything else worked properly.

I bought this for the purpose of extending my eero network as well as use it to see clock and other Alexa stuff.Pro - Looks nice on desk, I got light blue. Speaker seems ok.Con - It actually limited my wifi in the room I placed this. The reason is that I found there is some sort of limit on it. I was getting better wifi signal without it. It actually dropped my wifi from 200mbps to 35mbps which is significant. I returned it immediately. If you are buying it for the clock, display is small and not that bright. I would rather spend this money on echo show 5 which is of similar price and gives you much better value. For $50, this does not make sense at all. You would buy this only as a cheap alternative for wifi extender and that too place where you are getting no wifi and ok with at max bandwidth of 35mbps. I can tell, you will soon get very frustrated and turn off wifi extender and at that point it’s no better than the cheapest echo dot which comes for $5 in deals mostly.

reviewTitle: Worked well for about a week...
reviewDescription: My new Echo Dot (5th Gen w Clock) worked perfectly for the first week, and suddenly and inexplicably now pauses every 20 seconds or so.  I ask it to resume, then it resumes for the next 20 seconds, then pauses.  Based on Amazon's Echo forum, this appears to be a common problem, but for some reason Amazon has yet to correct it.  Based on feedback from other users, i have restarted and reset the device, as well as my router.  Nothing worked.  Suggestions that it may be cause by "poor wifi" or proximity to the router make no sense, because my wife has a gen 3 device in next room, which is further away, and it continues to work without interruption.  Bottom line:  I don't recommend this device until Amazon resolves this problem.  This is very frustruating

I saw this and said wow this will be a big help to me was I wrong nothing but a headache. Have tried to get this thing to work now for almost a month and it gets just about everything wrong in one week it starts repeating the reminders all day long to the point that I get upset with it. I thought this would be a great thing to help me remember appointments and help remember to take my meds on time every time it's not I bought the smart plugs to try and help keep the home at a current temp and Alexa could do all this this it can't. The only thing I found it can do is to tell time and temp outside and inside. This might be a good start on some kind of AI or ok the talk to kids but for older people just keep your blood pusher meds handy LOL.

Seriously if you looking for a long-term user this is not the product. I got mine on Oct 13-22. Two days before it stopped working and I contacted Amazon customer care. They told my warranty had expired so they couldn't help and offered me a discount to purchase another Echo. I used it for only one year. And it stopped working after my warranty ended. It's wasted my money. I don't know any other people who have the same problem as me. But now I'm not going to buy this trash again.

reviewTitle: 2 Echo dots with clocks-  Both ceased working after 10 months.  A rip off!!
reviewDescription: I bought  2  Echo Dots with clocks.  Both have stopped responding to my voice after 10 months of working fine.  Very expensive for something that has such a sort life.  I am returning them as the warranty window 12 months it looks like.  Amazon customer service is really crappy and when you search for answers,  very little good information can be found.  I searched for 20 minutes and never did find an answer to what the warranty period actually was.

reviewTitle: Stopped working after 3 months, 5th Gen w/ clock
reviewDescription: Absolutely loved it... while it worked (3 - 4 months). Performed all trouble shooting techniques recommended by Amazon and YouTube to no avail. The clock still works (nice clock on my desk for the price, lol.) Refuses to connect to wifi. It is Eero enabled. LOVE my other echo devices - best (and only) personal assistants I've ever had. Unfortunately, it's too late to return it. 😪

I bought this echo 5th generation with the clock and it just stopped working. It sits in my formal front room where it hardly gets used. I’ve tried unplugging it and doing all the reset steps and nothing works. No sounds no lights, just turns off and then it’s dead. I have no young children or anyone who even comes in this room so there’s no reason it should be broken. I have 7 of the older version echos the flat ones and I’ve had them for years. Never have I had an issue with one just stop working. This is a piece of junk and for the amount of money you pay you would think it would be better then the older versions but it’s not. DON’T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THESE NEWER VERSIONS WITH THE CLOCK. Go for the older versions that are flat.

I bought this product and thought it was going to be great to use.  I first bought a smart light bulb, and I couldn't get it to work.  It took a call to support to finally get the bulb to work and I do love that it works now.  So why the bad review.  Because I bought a Meross plug which states is compatible with Alexa.  I couldn't get it to work.  Call support and they tried to walk me through it, and it still did not work.  We couldn't get it to connect to Alexa.  It said it was connected, but it couldn't be found in the connected devices.  The tech refunded the price, and I must send it back.  My schedule is very busy and this extra chore is not appreciated.I have had a person computer since 1984.  I do not usually have issues, but working with Alexa is very difficult.  That is why it is getting a one star review.

The color is different than what the site describes and different than the site’s photos. It is NOT white, it is light blue. Don’t understand why Amazon would call the product glacier white as it obviously is not. Other than the color, it’s a decent device.
I have a hockey puck echo but I wanted this one because of the clock feature. I like it but it has this very bright light that won’t go out. Thinking about returning it. Otherwise it works great.
I like that this dot is small & convenient unfortunately I don’t like the sound quality the highest it goes still sound low to my liking. I  like the first generation way better it was much louder.

The novelty of asking it questions is fun but, you end up primarily using it to play music. It has decent sound quality for the price, easy set up. My only complaint is that it has to remain plugged in as it has no battery.

reviewTitle: I love these Dots, but a couple issues
reviewDescription: I've been using Amazon Alexa Dots since quarantine. I love the sound quality, the size of the unit and the shade of white. This new generation has a couple issues, in my opinion. I don't like that I can't turn off the thing where it displays the name of a song that I'm playing - I already know what I'm playing and sometimes I want to see the time right after putting a song on and now I have to wait for the artist and title scroll to finish. Also, and maybe this is just me, but I have to repeat myself to Alexa a lot more with this one than with the previous generation. Finally, I liked the font on the display for the previous generation better. These are largely superficial issues individually but together make me a little less enthused than with my previous Dot.

This would be a great product if it didn't periodically make a startling crackling sound that scares my son out of sleep, homework, or whatever else he's doing. It's become an overpriced dust collector bc he doesn't like to have it turned on.
Love it but I keep getting random bright blue light at night. Wake me up every-time with its bright LED. Might have to place this elsewhere instead of in the bedroom.
I can’t get the sound to remain at a constant level.  I set it for level 6 and it keeps dropping down to 3.  I have not heard the alarm twice.  It’s very annoying.
I was hoping it would have been a little bit bigger and louder. I had to raise it up higher so I can hear it in the next room.
I got this mostly to use as a Bluetooth speaker but it seems like most of the apps I want to listen to things on won't connect to it.

I love playing music on it, the only thing that irritates me is that it resorts to amazon music unless i say “on spotify” even though i set spotify as the primary music app. love all the features of it though!
I’ve had my Alexa for a while and I love it
Had one of these devices that dropped and broke it. Got a new one for Christmas. Love this device for clock, but wish it was easier to change brightness. Easy set up.
It’s not quite the color thought it would be from the pictures I saw but the clock quite big and the things it can show you are a nice bonus
I love it!! I replaced my old Echo Dot because it was acting up. This one is great! And I like that even if the power goes out during the night, this one is always right! ❤️
I have to reset then a lot.Alexa Guard no longer works with and even if you set up Emergency Assist, Alexa Guard is supposed to work but doesn't.

reviewTitle: Nice looking and more volume than the flex model
reviewDescription: Like the looks and the ability to adjust the sound volume. Clock and visible countdown timer is wonderful addition. The one negative is the sound is a bit on the basie side, thus four stars instead of five.

reviewTitle: Not as nice as previous generation
reviewDescription: I highly prefer the display of the previous generation over the complete blocky style of the new generation. Other than that, I feel they are pretty much equivalent in sound and features.

Purchase this for my grandson for Christmas so he could get up in the mornings on his own. It’s very easy to set up and it came with a lightbulb that you can change colors. Very nice gift very satisfied.
I bought one without the clock and regretted not having that easily read time of day. Love this one. Would've preferred a Green color to coordinate with my bedroom but ...
